title: Emergency Room Registrar
description:
Emergency Room Registrar


Part-Time

  

  

At White Plains Hospital, you have an opportunity to work side-by-side with some of the most talented people in the world.


We have been widely recognized for our exceptional culture, world-class physicians, Magnet-designated nurses and passionate employees who make a real difference in our community. With tremendous growth opportunities, great benefits, and flexible work schedules, it is no wonder why we are consistently recognized as a **Great Place To Work.**


**Position Summary**


Greets and receipts for all patients are presented to the emergency department. Performs registration for all emergency department patients and maintains statistical logs. Validates status of insurance with-in the insurance verification system. Refers incoming calls to appropriate personnel. Follows observation protocol. Work closely with all clinical staff. Performs other duties as requested by management.


**Essential Functions and Responsibilities Include the Following:**


1. Understands and adheres to the WPH Performance Standards, Policies and Behaviors.


2. Receipts & greets all patients arriving at the main ED entrance window or the EMS entrance.


3. Provides Identification Bracelet for all patients upon arrival.


4. Registers all patients requiring Emergency Services.


5. Record and complete all necessary patient demographic and billing information in the HIS.


6. Scan insurance cards, patient identification; face sheets sent in with patients arriving from other healthcare facilities.


7. Obtains and witnesses all signed consents related to the registration for treatment and billing purposes.


8. Provide each patient with all mandatory documents (i.e. HIPPA, Patient Bill of Rights, Observation Folder)


9. Responsible for collection of patient responsibility/co-pays after medical services.


10. Deposit daily co-pay collections into a safe with all required receipts, reconciliation sheets and reports in a sealed envelope with your signature on the envelope.


11. Follow Observation Protocol when a patient is assigned from the ED.


12. Maintain statistical data from the ED Daily Log w/ L&D and well patients.


13. Performs all other related duties as assigned.


**Education & Experience Requirements**


High School Diploma required.


Previous hospital experience preferred the ability to utilize copier, printer, scanner and fax equipment


Knowledge of Microsoft Outlook and computer terminals plus medical terminology is helpful but not mandatory.


Bilingual Helpful but not required.


**Core Competencies**


Ability to work cohesively within our team, clinical staff and environmental staff


Must be able to speak, write, understand and communicate the English language Effectively communicate with patients and family members with integrity to handle the confidential aspects of work


Ability to deviate from assigned tasks without notice to meet the needs of the department


Maintains composure under stress


**Physical/Mental Demands/Requirements & Work Environment**


* Ability to remain in a stationary position 50% of the time


* Must be able to move around inside the office to access charts, physicians' orders and patients' charts from the printer.


* Must be able to constantly move from Admitting to ATC, Radiology and Ambulatory unit to escort patients for their test/ procedure.


* Must be able to communicate with patients when they come in for a test or procedure and able to communicate with patients who have questions about their bills /financial obligations. Must be able to convey and exchange accurate information


* Must be able to recognize patients when they arrive at the reception area and greet patients


* Must be able to inspect patients' charts for accuracy.


* Must be able to transport patients in a wheelchair from Admitting to the Ambulatory Unit.


* Must be able to Observe a Tele Tracking monitor for extended period of time


* Must be able to constantly operate a computer, scanner and credit card machine.


* May be exposed to chemicals necessary to perform required tasks. Any hazardous chemicals the employee may be exposed to are listed in the hospital's SDS (Safety Data Sheet) database and may be accessed through the hospital's Intranet site (Employee Tools/SDS Access). A copy of the SDS database can also be found at the hospital switchboard, saved on a disc. (Standard for all Job Descriptions)


**Primary Population Served**


Check the appropriate box(s) below:


Neonatal (birth – 28 days) Patients with exceptional communication needs


Infant (29 days – less than 1 year) Patients with developmental delays


Pediatric (1 – 12 years) Patients at end of life


Adolescent (13 – 17 years) Patients under isolation precautions


Adult (18 – 64 years) Patients with cultural needs


Geriatric (> 65 years) All populations


Bariatric Patients with weight related comorbidities. **Non-patient care population**


The responsibilities and tasks outlined in this job description are not exhaustive and may change as determined by the needs of White Plains Hospital.


Pay scale: $27.60/hr- $41.43/hr

  

Location: White Plains Hospital · Patient Access ED  

Schedule: Part Time, Night, Tue, Wed Fri and alternating weekends and holidays
company_description: White Plains Hospital is a proud member of the Montefiore Health System, serving as its tertiary hub of advanced care in the Hudson Valley.

title: Junior Sales Representative
description:
About The Chefs' Warehouse
  
The Chefs' Warehouse, Inc. (http://www.chefswarehouse.com) combines exceptional quality and brand building with broadline food service distribution for more than 35 years. With Protein, Specialty, Produce, and Broadline offerings, we service the most discerning chefs in a hybrid approach of convenience and superior quality. We introduce more than 2,000 artisan producers of the world’s finest ingredients from over 40 countries to the finest chefs in the world. We passionately consult, sell, and build relationships with more than 35,000 customers through the most experienced network of over 600 consultive sales associates, best-in-breed technology, rapid service, and support levels that solidify our long-standing ties to both established and up-and-coming premium restaurants.
  
  

**Mission:** The mission of The Chefs’ Warehouse is to provide the world’s greatest ingredients to the world’s best chefs.
  
  

**Our C.H.E.F.S. Values:**  

Curious & Creative
  
Hungry For Food & Results
  
Entrepreneurial
  
Forward Thinking & Flexible
  
Supportive (Of Peers & Chefs)
  
  

**Position Summary:** As a key member of our rapidly growing organization, ourSales Associate ultimately acts as the face of our company by delivering outstanding customer service and building strong relationships. Youwill be responsible for selling our fine products to restaurants and caterers, hotels and retail establishments by performing the following duties:
  
  

**What you’ll do:**  

* Produce sales revenue through the development and growth of new sales and by increasing sales with existing accounts.
* Compile lists of prospective customers for use as sales leads, based on information from networking, newspapers, business directories, industry ads, trade shows, Internet Web sites, and other sources.
* Travel throughout assigned territory and/or call on regular and prospective customers to secure orders.
* Display or demonstrate product using samples or catalog, and emphasize saleable features.
* Quote prices and credit terms and prepare sales contracts for orders obtained.
* Estimate date of delivery to customer, based on knowledge of own firm's production and delivery schedules.
* Prepare reports of business transactions and keep updated expense accounts.
* Work with inside sales representatives to keep account activities and literature up to date.
* Track stock levels.
* Enter new customer data and other sales data for current customers into computer database.
* Develop and maintain relationships with purchasing contacts.


**About you:**  

* One to two years of relevant experience in sales is highly desired
* Previous sales experience in restaurant, food sales, or professional catering, and/or working as a Chef is preferred
* High energy, positive and enthusiastic attitude, a strong team player profile
* Foster a positive and innovative atmosphere which encourages people to commit to the task in hand and go beyond the call of duty in order to achieve key objectives
* Driven and motivated to take responsibility and ensure successful outcomes across activities despite obstacles
* Excellent organizational skills with the ability to handle and prioritize multiple concurrent projects and initiatives
* Outstanding verbal and written communication skills, developing a culture of participation and involvement
* Gather facts and figures, monitor self and others and achieve goals in a timely and factual manner
* Self-starter, must ask questions and learn new skills quickly on the job
* Bring a sense of urgency and work under tight deadlines with short turnarounds in a fast-paced working environment
* College Degree desired but not required
* Candidates must live in the assigned geographic sales area


#LI-ND1

title: Roxbury Elementary School: Instructional Paraeducator
description:
JobID: 11837  

**Position Type:**  

 Paraeducators/Instructional Paraeducators  

**Date Posted:**  

 8/19/2024  

**Location:**  

 Stamford, CT  

**Date Available:**  

 2024 - 2025 School Year  

**Closing Date:**  

 until filled  


**The filling of this position is based upon continued funding in the Board of Education budget.**  

  

**POSITION TITLE:** INSTRUCTIONAL PARAEDUCATOR  

  

**PURPOSE:**  

To serve as an integral member of the classroom team by assisting the teacher and district in providing services that support the district's mission to educate all children to higher levels.  

  

**SUPERVISION RECEIVED:**  

Certified Staff Professional(s) and/or appropriate Administrator.  

  

**EXAMPLE OF DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:**
+ Work with individual students or small groups of students, under the supervision of a certified teacher, to reinforce learning of materials or skills initially introduced by the teacher.
+ Record achievements and diagnostic tests, under the direction of the teacher, for individual students or groups of students.
+ Assist the teacher(s) in devising special strategies for reinforcing material or skills based on a sympathetic understanding of individual students, their needs, interests, and abilities.
+ Follow student schedule, as written by certified staff, i.e. administrators, teachers, resource, etc. and seek clarification as needed.
+ Assist the teacher(s) in the handling, operation, and care of equipment used in the classroom, including media and instructional materials.
+ Assist with the supervision of students during emergency drills, assembles, play periods, field trips, and in other non-classroom activities.
+ Check notebooks, correct papers, and supervise testing and make-up work, as assigned by the teacher(s).
+ Assist the teacher(s) with non-instructional duties, such as snacks.
+ Serve as the chief source of information and help to any substitute teacher(s) assigned in the absence of the regular teacher.
+ Assist the teacher(s) in drill work, large group reading, or storytelling.
+ Alert the teacher(s) regarding any problem or special information related to an individual student.
+ Perform support duties as assigned by the teacher(s) as needed.
+ Maintain the same high level of ethical behavior and sensitivity of information about students as is expected of a certified teacher or assistant teacher.
+ Help students master equipment or instructional materials assigned by teacher.
+ Keep bulletin board and other classroom learning displays up to date.
+ Guide independent study, enrichment work, and remedial work set as assigned by the teacher.
+ Distribute and collect workbooks, papers, and other materials for instruction as needed.
+ Assist in providing a well-organized, smoothly functioning school environment.
+ Talk to and attempt to calm student(s) who as distressed.
+ Participate in professional development training programs, as required.
+ Perform other related duties, as assigned.

**KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES:**
+ Effective communication and interpersonal skills.
+ Demonstrated ability to understand and follow oral and written instructions effectively.
+ Exhibits proficiency in basic reading, math, writing, and speaking English.
+ Must possess or be willing to acquire the skills necessary to work productively with children.
+ Appropriate reading, spelling, writing, and math skills to support student.
+ Physical condition commensurate with the demands of, at a minimum, the essential functions of the position.
+ Must exhibit good judgment, patience, tact, and courtesy.
+ Utilizes and maintains ethical practices for confidential communication about students.

**MINIMUM Qualifications:**
+ Pass the ParaPro Assessment, hold an Associate's Degree, or have completed at least 60 credits at an approved college.
+ Must meet NCLB compliance requirements, as applicable.
+ Must possess or be willing to acquire the skills necessary to support any specialized programs for Special Needs students, including support of behavioral plans, strategies for autism or other identified diagnoses, or support for treatments such as ABA or activities of daily living such as feeding and toileting.
+ Experience/training in working with children preferred.
+ Comfort with use of standard computer applications.
+ Such additions and alternatives to the above qualifications as may be appropriate and acceptable.

**PHYSICAL DEMANDS:**  

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to perform the essential functions of this job successfully. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.+ While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit for extended periods of time to view & operate computer equipment, and to stand for extended periods of time to assist student(s) and/or staff.
+ The employee frequently is required to stand, walk, sit, bend, stoop and kneel.
+ The employee is frequently required to reach with hands and arms.
+ The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 10 pounds.
+ Specific vision abilities required by this job include vision, distance vision, and the ability to adjust focus.

**EMPLOYEE GROUP:** Paraeducators of Stamford Association  

  

**WORK YEAR:** As per Bargaining Agreement  

  

**COMPENSATION:**$22,320 to $40,174  

Step Placement is based on education and experience as outlined in the Paraeducator Contract.  

  

**Application Procedures:**  

Online application is required.  

  

**Internal Applicants:** Please upload a cover letter (summarizing your interest in and qualifications for the position) and resume as part of your Internal Application.

title: Dolan Middle School: School Counselor (Interim Contract – Leave Replacement)
description:
JobID: 11838  

**Position Type:**  

 School Counseling  

**Date Posted:**  

 8/19/2024  

**Location:**  

 Stamford, CT  

**Date Available:**  

 2024-2025 School Year **The filling of this position is based upon continued funding in the Board of Education budget.**  

  

**Note: Teachers dually certified in TESOL, Bilingual Education or ESL, with experience in Sheltered Instruction or fluency in a language other than English, will be given preference for all Stamford Public School positions.**  

  

  

**Job Description** – School Counselor  

  

**General Statement:**  

The School Counselor is responsible for assisting students in attaining their maximum personal and educational development by offering a variety of support services including individual and group counseling, development and monitoring of students’ academic programs, consultation and collaboration with students, parents, community, faculty, administration, and the development of student and family informational programs. School Counselors implement a comprehensive school counseling program that promotes and supports college and career readiness for all students.  

  

**Major Responsibilities:**
+ Provides comprehensive counseling services to a diverse body of students to support post-secondary college and career success.
+ Implements comprehensive school counseling program in accordance with current state and national school counseling standards.
+ Provides individual and group sessions to students in the areas of academic planning and success, career awareness, and socio-emotional development.
+ Consults and collaborates with teachers, staff, families, and community members in understanding and meeting the needs of students in the school setting and enhancing their education.
+ Uses technology to implement comprehensive school counseling program to support college and career readiness and post-secondary success planning.
+ Serves as a member of the interdisciplinary team, and participates on the Planning and Placement Team, Student Support Team, and other teams and committees that support student progress.
+ Uses data to document the results of strategies and interventions that are used to improve student performance and to evaluate student and program needs.
+ Identifies at-risk students and collaborates with teachers and other professional staff to create appropriate interventions and recommendations.
+ Reviews and interprets modifications, accommodations, and intervention plans for all students.
+ Plans, coordinates, and conducts department and school wide activities that contribute to the social emotional, career, and academic goals of the school community, such as college fairs, college and career days, and other extensions of the school counseling curriculum.
+ Participate in activities that will support professional growth of knowledge and skills
+ Meets professional responsibilities.


  

**Knowledge and Skills:**
+ Demonstrated knowledge of state and federal laws pertaining to school counseling.
+ Adheres to preferred practices prescribed by state and national school counselor associations.
+ Demonstrate ability and willingness to work with a wide range of student personalities, backgrounds, and abilities.
+ Knowledge of various models and best practices of counseling.
+ Ability to apply known research and evaluation data to improve student learning.
+ Ability to utilize technology to interact with and engage students.
+ Excellent interpersonal, communication, advocacy, leadership, and collaboration skills with students, staff, families, and the community.
+ Ability to organize and coordinate work.
+ Ability to engage in self-evaluation with regard to performance and professional growth.
+ Knowledge of and/or demonstrate the ability to learn and implement Operating Systems (i.e. Windows); Office suites (i.e. Microsoft Office, Google Docs); Presentation Software (i.e. PowerPoint, Keynote); Spreadsheets (i.e. Excel, Google Spreadsheets); Communication and Collaboration tools (i.e. Skype); Accounting Software (i.e. QuickBooks); Student Information Systems (i.e. Naviance, Power School); or any other technology deemed relevant for this position.


  

**Qualifications:**
+ Connecticut State Department of Education Certification endorsed for School Counselor (068)

  

Board Approved 05/28/2019  

  

**Union:**  

Stamford Education Association (SEA)  

  

**Work Year:**  

In addition to the regular contracted 186 days, the School Counselors work 5 additional days, paid per diem.  

  

**Salary****:** $50,684 to $123,992  

Step Placement is based on education and experience as outlined in Article 4 (D) of the SEA Contract.  

  

**Application Procedures:**  

Online application is required.  

  

**Internal Applicants** - Please upload:
+ A cover letter summarizing your interest in and qualifications for this position


+ A resume


+ A minimum of 2 letters of reference, at least one of which is from a current supervisor



  

**External Applicants** - Please upload a minimum of 2 letters of reference, at least one of which is from a current or recent past supervisor.  

  

Letters of reference should be dated within the last two years.

title: Warehouse Receiver
description:
Stew Leonard’s, a family-owned and operated fresh food store founded in 1969, has locations in Connecticut, New York, and New Jersey. Stew’s earned its nickname, the “Disneyland of Dairy Stores” because of its country-fair atmosphere, with costumed characters and animated entertainment throughout the store that keep children entertained while parents shop.
  
  

Warehouse Receiver
  
Full-Time Hourly – Starting Range $16-$18+ Per Hour
  
Experience Preferred
  
Must be 18 Years Old
  
  

**Position Description:**  

A Warehouse Receiver is responsible for the receipt of product in a timely matter and keeping order in the warehouse. Maintaining a clean and orderly environment. As well as placing each order in the designated areas of the warehouse. The products are unloaded and reviewed for accuracy in the purchase orders. Review expected deliveries for the day on the dock schedule and rotating products in the freezer as needed.
  
  

**Your day-to-day:**  

* Review invoice and purchase orders before unloading each truck to make sure they match
* Unloading and breakdown of product from incoming deliveries
* Ensuring the product is complying with COOL laws and that it is accurate in quantities and not damaged in the transfer
* Filling out purchase orders and returns to the receiving office
* Fill out manifest based on what was received or loaded and return to receiving office
* Keeping the warehouse/work areas clean and clear of any abstract
* Safely operate a forklift, reach truck, walkie rider, and other equipment used daily my receivers
* The scope of the job may change as necessitated by business demands


**What you bring to the team:**  

* Excellent communication skills, both written and oral in English
* Good organizational skills
* Basic math skills
* The ability to multi-task


**Working Conditions:**  

* Being that the products are highly perishable the freezer is kept at a certain temperature
* The noise level is generally above the normal level due to the HVAC system
* The position requires frequent walking, standing, lifting, pulling, pushing, squatting and reaching with a maximum of 110lbs


Why you’ll love working here!
  
  

**Family Oriented:** We respect the personal balance between work and family with career opportunity and growth- over 80% of our managers have been promoted from within.
  
  

**Benefits:** High value, high quality Medical, Dental, and Vision coverage, 401 K plan for FT & PT team members, family & personal time, life insurance, and more!
  
  

**Environment:** Have you seen the Avocado Girls? Chiquita Banana? Or the singing Parrot?
  
  

**Pay Day:** We’re thrilled to offer our employees Dayforce Wallet – a new way to get paid. Say bye-bye to pay day and hello to pay your way. Get your pay as soon as you earn it, at no cost to you – It’s your money, why should you have to wait? Request your pay as you earn it.
  
  

We take pride in the power of diversity, inclusion, and being socially responsible to the communities which we live and do business
  
  

Apply today and start as soon as 1 week!
  
  

For more information on working at Stew Leonard’s click on the link below!
  
http://www.stewleonards.com/work-at-stews/
  
  

Stew Leonard's is an equal opportunity at will employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of age, race, religion, color, disability, sex, sexual orientation or national origin.

title: Civil Inspector
description:
20/20 provides expert engineering building solutions covering the Tri-State area for all required and applicable city, national and international code testing and inspections. Our professional services go beyond the day-to-day application of ensuring safety and building code compliance. Our technical team further enhances our industry specific needs with specialty and other out of the ordinary services.

Our state-of-the-art laboratory is meticulously operated with accuracy, precision and equipment that has the capacity to service large scale, intricate or unique projects.  
We partner with design professionals throughout the development, planning and construction phases of a project to facilitate their understanding, interpretation and application of code. Such collaboration results in a cohesive, well-planned and sustainable path to a successful project.

**Job Title: Civil Inspector**

**Location: New York City**

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Conduct thorough on-site inspections for construction projects in strict adherence to the NYC Building Code and all relevant rules and regulations.
* Verify that construction projects align with structural design requirements, maintaining safety and quality standards.
* Expertly identify and document any deficiencies found during inspections.
* Prepare detailed daily project reports, providing comprehensive descriptions of your inspections.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering and OSHA 10.
* ACI Level 1 preferred.
* Demonstrated ability to work both independently and collaboratively within a team.
* Eagerness to learn and develop your skills in the field.
* Exceptional oral and written communication skills.
* Punctuality and commitment to reporting all work promptly.

**Why Join Us:**

* **Exciting Projects:** Get the chance to work on high-profile projects that shape the iconic skyline of New York City.
* **Professional Growth:** We foster an environment where you can continuously learn and advance in your career.
* **Team Collaboration:** Be part of a dynamic team that values collaboration and innovation.
* **Competitive Benefits:** We offer a competitive salary and benefits package to reward your hard work.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $21.00 - $26.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Professional development assistance
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* Are you authorized to work in the U.S.?
* Do you have a civil engineering degree?

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Talent, Learning & Communications Manager
description:
Position Summary
The Talent, Learning & Communications Professional is a hands-on role that involves collaborating with the Head of Talent & Learning, Internal Communications Lead, HRBPs and business leaders to design, execute and analyze Talent Management, Learning & Development, and Internal Communications programs.  

  

This role will act as a visible partner to the business, reporting into the Head of Talent & Learning on items related to: performance management, talent reviews, succession planning, employee engagement, employee onboarding, manager training, and executive leadership development. Additionally, they will support our Internal Communications Lead on an as-needed basis, as other projects may arise in the course of day-to-day business.
Role and Responsibilities
Role and Responsibilities* Partner in the design and execution of innovative, scalable learning solutions that enable a continuous learning culture for Samsung Ads Sellers, Engineers, Product Managers, and more
* Manage communication strategy to promote and highlight key training initiatives
* Work with partner teams to source, allocate and coordinate proper resources for training, ensuring the right people are being provided the right training opportunities
* Work across the people team to gather data and provide insights into our high performers, high potentials, the success of training programs, and communication initiatives
* Manage the tools, processes and people to coordinate the logistical details and run our key training programs like New Hire Orientation, New Manager Training, Executive Leadership Development, etc.
* Facilitate trainings as needed (in-person and virtually), including a regular new-hire orientation program, manager trainings, annual process and systems overviews on topics ranging from Goal Setting, Mid-Year, Year-End Performance Reviews, and more
* Support the business with change management consulting for organizational and cultural transformation where required
* Possess the ability to handle change and ambiguity as we continue to build and scale
* Focused on leader and team development, working independently with leaders and high priority teams to support them in being as effective as possible


Skills and Qualifications
Skills and Qualifications* Bachelor's Degree with minimum 6 years of relevant experience
* Strong attention to detail along with exceptional written, verbal, and listening skills
* Must possess a high degree of sensitivity and operate with a sense of confidentiality
* Experience with annual talent management processes
* Demonstrated ability to build relationships and partner with team members at all levels
* The ability to plan, organize, and prioritize multiple and simultaneous Talent, Learning & Communications related projects in a changing corporate environment
* Ability to make professional presentations and communicate complex matters to an audience of high technical skills and operational experience
* Expertise in MS Office Suite required, especially Excel (pivot tables / VLOOKUPs), PowerPoint and Outlook


For candidates in New York, the salary range for this role is expected to be between $130,000 to $145,000. Actual pay will be determined considering factors such as relevant skills and experience, and comparison to other employees in the role  

At Samsung, we believe that innovation and growth are driven by an inclusive culture and a diverse workforce. We aim to create a global team where everyone belongs and has equal opportunities, inspiring our talent to be their true selves. Together, we are building a better tomorrow for our customers, partners, and communities.* Samsung Electronics America, Inc. and its subsidiaries are committed to employing a diverse workforce, and provide Equal Employment Opportunity for all individuals regardless of race, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a protected veteran, genetic information, status as a qualified individual with a disability, or any other characteristic protected by law.


Reasonable Accommodations for Qualified Individuals with Disabilities During the Application Process
Samsung Electronics America is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in our job application process. If you have a disability and require a reasonable accommodation in order to participate in the application process, please contact our Reasonable Accommodation Team (855-557-3247) or SEA\\_Accommodations\\_Ext@sea.samsung.com for assistance. This number is for accommodation requests only and is not intended for general employment inquiries.

title: ICC Mechanical Inspector
description:
20/20 provides expert engineering building solutions covering the Tri-State area for all required and applicable city, national and international code testing and inspections. Our professional services go beyond the day-to-day application of ensuring safety and building code compliance. Our technical team further enhances our industry specific needs with specialty and other out of the ordinary services.

Our state-of-the-art laboratory is meticulously operated with accuracy, precision and equipment that has the capacity to service large scale, intricate or unique projects.  
We partner with design professionals throughout the development, planning and construction phases of a project to facilitate their understanding, interpretation and application of code. Such collaboration results in a cohesive, well-planned and sustainable path to a successful project.

**JOB DESCRIPTION**

* Perform skilled mechanical, plumbing, and fuel gas code inspections to verify compliance to a variety of systems, including the most technically complex engineered commercial systems to ensure installation in accordance with approved project drawings, codes, standards, and specifications.
* Inspect and verify testing of wet and dry heating and cooling systems, ducts and piping, fuel gas piping, refrigeration systems, building ventilation systems, exhaust systems, product conveying and hazardous exhaust systems and all related equipment for conformity to plans, approved materials, installation instructions and corresponding code requirements.
* Inspect complex commercially engineered systems specific to the building and its use. Interpret code requirements to verify commercial building systems operate together.
* Read and interpret on-site approved plans, notes, specifications, material and equipment listings and installation instructions.
* Verify equipment and fuel gas sizing is correct, installed and tested in compliance with code requirements.

**REQUIREMENTS**

* ICC Commercial Mechanical Inspector Certification required.
* 10-hour OSHA safety training certification required.
* Thorough knowledge of NYC mechanical, plumbing, and fuel gas codes, rules and ordinances; extensive knowledge of mechanical and fuel gas installation practices, systems and materials and intermediate knowledge of legal processes involved in the enforcement of building codes and ordinances.

title: Boutique Key Holder
description:
We are currently looking to hire a Weekend Key Holder for our boutique store in beautiful Cold Spring NY. This position is part time 10-15 hours per week, with weekend availability required but you don't have to work both days unless you'd want to. Pay range is $16-$19/hr depending on experience.

Our ideal candidate likes fashion, is eco-conscious, and is into supporting small businesses and communities. Being friendly and outgoing is our top priority to make visitors feel welcome and excited to check out our shop. title: Order Expeditor for Customer Service
description:
**Customer Service Order Expeditor** 

At Tribeca Cabinetry, we are dedicated to delivering beautiful, high-quality kitchen cabinetry at an affordable price. Our team thrives on challenges, embraces a positive mindset, and excels in dynamic environments. If you are a motivated individual with a strong work ethic, a team-oriented attitude, and a passion for growth, we want you to join our team! We are committed to nurturing our employees, offering mentorship, and fostering leadership from the moment you join us.

We are seeking a driven, detail-oriented, and energetic individual with a strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel to fill the role of Customer Service Order Expeditor.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Expedite and manage daily orders to ensure timely delivery.
* Collaborate closely with the customer service department, production, and shipping teams.
* Coordinate all in-plant activities to meet production deadlines.
* Oversee outsource vendor activities to ensure production commitments are met.
* Maintain consistent communication with the Shipping and Scheduling Manager to track progress and address any issues.
* Ensure seamless communication between Scheduling, Shipping, and the customer.
* Monitor and track order progress using the ERP system.
* Provide support for general office activities as needed.

**Essential Skills:**

* A minimum of 3 years of experience in manufacturing, preferably in a job shop environment involving fabrication, machining, and assembly.
* Strong communication skills to effectively engage suppliers and ensure adherence to specifications.
* Proven negotiation skills to secure supplier compliance.
* Ability to work effectively under pressure while maintaining a high level of customer service.
* Performance-driven with a creative approach to problem-solving.
* Exceptional attention to detail, with the ability to multitask, manage time efficiently, and prioritize multiple tasks.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office, particularly Word and Excel; experience with MRP/ERP systems is a plus.

**Qualifications:**

* High school diploma or equivalent.

Join our team and grow with us as we continue to set new standards in the cabinetry industry!

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

title: Nurse Practitioner (BH)
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals**
--------------------------------

  


Elmhurst Hospital Center (EHC) is the major tertiary care provider in the borough of Queens. The hospital is comprised of 545 beds and is a Level I Trauma Center, an Emergency Heart Care Station and a 911 Receiving Hospital. It is the premiere health care organization for key areas such as Surgery, Cardiology, Women's Health, Pediatrics, Rehabilitation Medicine, Renal and Mental Health Services.


At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.


**Work Shifts**
---------------

  


7:00 A.M – 8:30 P.M


**Job Description**
-------------------

  


Under general supervision, serves as a licensed, independent practitioner responsible for planning, coordinating, delivering and managing comprehensive health care services in a health care setting. Ensures patient and family centered quality care to improve outcomes and patient experience, in accordance with applicable NYC Health + Hospitals policies and procedures, state and federal rules and regulations and nursing standards of care.


**Duties & Responsibilities**
-----------------------------

  


1. Provides continuous comprehensive medical and nursing care, including preventive and supportive health care services to patients and families.


2. Manages health problems and coordinates health care for various patient populations. Identifies and diagnoses illnesses and physical conditions, and implements therapeutic and corrective measures.


3. Consistent with the established nursing practice, differentiates between normal and abnormal findings in the screening process to detect changes in health status that require physician’s intervention.


4. Develops and maintains partnerships with community-based organizations and makes referrals to consulting physicians and/or other health care professionals and community agencies, as necessary.


5. Evaluates and interprets patient data, in order to plan and implement appropriate nursing interventions.


6. Consults with physicians and other health care practitioners in the evaluation of health screening findings to make prospective decisions about treatment that will best support improved outcomes and patient satisfaction.


7. Formulates differential diagnosis and the plan of care based on medical history, physical exams, nursing assessment and other pertinent information. Identifies health and medical risks and needs.


8. Develops, implements, and evaluates patient plan of care. Determines effectiveness and modifies as per clinical standards and practice protocols, where needed, to achieve medical and health goals.


9. Orders, conducts, and interprets diagnostic and laboratory tests. Identifies and may prescribe appropriate pharmacological and non-pharmacological interventions and therapies.


10. Manages a patient session schedule allowing for both scheduled and non-emergent unscheduled visits; maintains a work schedule that ensures availability and continuity of care; ensures optimal availability and utilization of appropriate resources.


11. Provides education, guidance, and direction to nursing staff and other members of the health care team to ensure quality and safe medical and nursing care is provided.


12. Provides education and counseling to patients and families regarding health status, treatment and progress, medication management, disease prevention and health promotion, records and maintains a system of relevant documentation.


13. Performs other related duties, as directed.


**Minimum Qualifications**
--------------------------

  


1. A valid New York State license and current registration to practice as a Registered Professional Nurse issued by the New York State Department of Education (NYSED); and


2. Current certificate as a Nurse Practitioner issued by the NYSED; and


3. Holds, or obtains through facility orientation, a valid and current certification in Basic Life Support (BLS) through the American Heart Association (AHA).


**How To Apply**
----------------

  


If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online at employment.nychhc.org.


NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:

* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
* Multiple employee discounts programs
company_description: We always put patients first! NYCHHC is committed to excellence in health care and the safety of people in the City of New York.

title: Sales - Wireless Specialist
description:

What will you do in your role?
  
  

You will get to know your customers and to discover their needs. You will provide them with individualized customer service in order to equip them with the wireless products and services they need. As a Retail Sales Representative, you will practice Russell Cellular’s core values of Integrity, Expertise, Initiative and Service and will live out our brand foundation of Care for Every Person with your team, customers and members of the communities in which we do business. If you're self-motivated and interested in a career in retail sales, if you are looking for an opportunity for growth and financial stability, then you need to consider being a Wireless Specialist for Russell Cellular, a Verizon Authorized Retailer.
  
  

**Duties & Responsibilities include:**

Job requirements

As you will be the face of our team, we will offer you uncapped earning potential and opportunities for advancement.
  
  

Come and join us and be a part of the Russell Cellular success!
  
  

Equal Opportunity Employer Statement
  
Russell Cellular is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state, or local laws.
  
  

This policy applies to all employment practices within our organization, including hiring, recruiting, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, leave of absence, compensation, benefits, training, and apprenticeship. Russell Cellular makes hiring decisions based solely on qualifications, merit, and business needs at the time.

title: Driver & Warehouse Assistant
description:
Cryoport, Inc. is redefining temperature controlled supply chain support for the life sciences industry by continually broadening its platform of solutions, serving the biopharma, reproductive medicine and animal health markets.
Driver/Warehouse Assistant
Valley Stream, NY
Full time, M-F
TSA certification required
Bluebird Express (https://bluexps.com/), a CRYOPDP company (www.cryopdp.com), is seeking a Driver/Warehouse Assistant at its Valley Stream, New York facility.
The main function of this role will be the pickup and delivery of temperature-controlled shipments between the Bluebird Express warehouse, major airports and client locations. When needed, this role will fulfill warehouse duties as well.
Prior experience in the handling of cold chain, temperature-controlled biological materials is not required but a plus. This role reports directly to the Operations Manager.
Primary responsibilities (include but are not limited to):* Stock control including periodic cycle counts of product and packaging material
* Preparing & conditioning TCP incl. handling of phase change materials
* Recording and data entering all information regarding temp-controlled packaging
* Physical picking and packing of materials. Load, unload, prepare, inspect, and operate a delivery vehicle
* Assist with preparing and charging vapor shipping tanks (dry shippers) with liquid nitrogen according to charging and safety procedures
* Communicate directly with clients during delivery and pick-up assignments
* Comply with all TSA Regulations such as planned route and locking vehicle at all times
* Complete driver logs and reports as assigned
* Receive empty dry shippers, clean, sanitize, and ready for next use
* Comply with quality & safety guidelines for handling materials and operating equipment
* Deliver a wide variety of items to different addresses through different routes
* Follow routes and schedule
* Ask for feedback on provided services and resolve clients complaints
* Follow DOT regulations and safety standards
* Ensure all traffic laws are observed
* Ensure safety precautions are implemented and maintained during transit and while in the warehouse
* Perform other duties as assigned


Work schedule
Monday through Friday, 8:30 - 5 PM plus occasional out-of-hours and weekend coverage as needed.
Required skills*Profile* *(experience/education)** High school Diploma or equivalent
* Minimum 1 yrs proven Delivery driver experience
* Physical ability to lift up to 80 lbs
* English language proficient

*Specific Experience & Knowledge Required** Safety culture and quality-oriented
* Ability to operate forklifts and tractors in all weather and traffic conditions
* Familiar with airline documentation and TSA Regulations
* Experience with major airlines and their processes when tendering and recovering shipments
* Experience with TSA Security measures as per TSA Security Training offerings
* Able to learn and operate data logger devices, handheld scanners, and other power equipment as directed
* Working knowledge in cold chain management/strong in cold chain facilities. (Willing to train)


Interpersonal skills ("Essential")* Rigorous/strong attention to detail
* Highly organized and prioritization skills
* Communicate with clarity and impact
* Strong customer service orientation with a high sense of urgency
* Collaborative
* Team player
* Flexible and adaptable


COMPENSATION: $26.44 hr.
Bluebird Express/CRYOPDP is an equal opportunity employer offering a competitive salary and the opportunity to contribute to a highly successful and growing global healthcare business. Benefits include health, dental, vision, life, short/long term disability insurances, 401K with match and stock equity (NASDAQ:CYRX).

title: Analyst, Business Planning & Strategy
description:
***Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery… the stuff dreams are made of.***

**Who We Are…**

When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the *storytellers* bringing our characters to life, the *creators* bringing them to your living rooms and the *dreamers* creating what’s next…


From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.


The Distribution Business Planning & Strategy team is responsible for developing and executing a comprehensive strategy to drive subscription volume and revenue for Warner Brothers Discovery’s Distribution business, focusing on Global App Platforms, Channels, MVPD, Virtual MVPD, and FAST distributors across Max, Cinemax, Discovery+, the Basic Networks, and more*.*

**PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Supports team in developing overarching Max subscription, activation, and engagement strategies for Distribution, in collaboration with full Distribution team and other WBD stakeholders. Organizes into a cohesive story in support of the annual Distribution Business Plan.
* Supports team in modeling and communicating subscriber goals (in partnership with Finance teams) and activation/engagement goals.
* Pulls and interprets data/reporting metrics via Looker, excel, and other tools. Develops and communicates additional reporting needs to the Analytics & Insights teams.
* Supports creation of and updates to various internal team documents, including trackers (subscriber reporting, offer performance, competitive info, etc.) and performance decks.
* Works with Partner Mgmt to confirm accuracy of data for external decks (e.g., QBRs).
* Works with Analytics & Insights team to request & develop necessary ad-hoc statistical analyses to support business strategies, marketing plans, and product roadmap prioritization.
* Upholds a ‘test and learn’ approach for all new portfolio initiatives by evaluating performance after execution of each initiative to optimize go-forward strategy. Leverages disparate sources of information to do so, including quantitative analyses from the Analytics & Insights team as well as other factors that influence performance (marketing/merchandising, partner relationships, etc.).
* Takes on project management role in supporting execution of distribution and streaming initiatives, including ongoing coordination across various teams.
* Knowledgeable on competitive trends within OTT space (new launches, competitor promotions, etc.), and translates to WBD as applicable. Compiles and reports out findings/recommendations.
* Cultivates and manages relationships with internal stakeholders. Facilitates the constant flow of information between teams that is critical to the day-to-day business.

**QUALIFICATIONS**

* Bachelor’s degree required.
* Analytical and motivated. Comfort with ambiguity and quickly changing priorities (required)
* Expertise with Excel & PowerPoint (required). Prior experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau) a plus.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills. A naturally strong collaborator (required)
* Strong organizational & time management skills (required)

**How We Get Things Done…**


This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/ along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.

**Championing Inclusion at WBD**


Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of our society and the world around us. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.
If you’re a qualified candidate and you require adjustments or accommodations to search for a job opening or apply for a position, please contact us at recruitadmin@wbd.com.
In compliance with local law, we are disclosing the compensation, or a range thereof, for roles in locations where legally required. Actual salaries will vary based on several factors, including but not limited to external market data, internal equity, location, skill set, experience, and/or performance. Base pay is just one component of Warner Bros. Discovery’s total compensation package for employees. Pay Range: $77,000.00 - $143,000.00 salary per year. Other rewards may include annual bonuses, short- and long-term incentives, and program-specific awards. In addition, Warner Bros. Discovery provides a variety of benefits to employees, including health insurance coverage, an employee wellness program, life and disability insurance, a retirement savings plan, paid holidays and sick time and vacation.

title: Front Desk Coordinator -Full Time
description:
Full Time Front Desk Medical Coordinator
  
  

At RestorixHealth, our mission is simple…to restore health and improve the quality of life!
  
  

We are seeking a customer service driven Front Desk Medical Coordinator for our state of the art wound care facilities. Responsible for scheduling patients, precertification, insurance verification, charge entry and daily reconciliations, this position will wear many hats. Individuals who have found success in this role have had previous experience in medical coding, billing and/or pre-certification. The ideal candidate is tech savvy, self-motivated and works well independently and as part of a team. Ongoing training will provide you the tools to be successful in your role.
  
Every position at Restorixhealth contributes to enhancing the lives of the patients we serve. You too, can be an integral part of our team, APPLY TODAY!
  
  

**What We Offer:**  

* Monday – Friday schedule, no weekends
* Comprehensive benefits package (Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, 401k)
* Generous paid time off
* Internal ongoing educational opportunities
* Competitive compensation
* Great work/life balance


**What You’ll Do:**  

* Schedule HBO Therapy or wound care visit, utilizing hospital software/systems as well as RXH’s EMR system
* Book appointments appropriately based on time, staffing, equipment and supplies
* Confirm all registration information with the patient and or responsible party
* Verify specific insurance benefits and obtain preauthorization for wound care procedures
* Patient visit charge information to be provided by wound center personnel and provided to the respective billing/finance departments or entered directly into hospital charge entry systems in accordance with hospital policies and acceptable standards
* Perform daily patient schedule: charge entry reconciliations and account for all outstanding superbills
* Ensure patient satisfaction and provide professional patient and staff support


**Qualifications:**  

* Proof of COVID-19 vaccination by date of hire is required.
* High school diploma or equivalent
* Experience in front desk role in a hospital outpatient or medical practice setting preferred
* Intermediate Microsoft Office skills (Word, Excel, Outlook)
* Exceptional customer service skills, able to promote a positive environment.
* Ability to maintain confidentiality, per HIPPA regulations


At RestorixHealth, we grow talent. When you join our team, you have the opportunity to develop your career based on your strengths and potential, including the possibility to move functionally, geographically, laterally and vertically. This is a career destination for engaged, caring, passionate and talented people who want to make a difference. We are the leader in the development and management of comprehensive wound healing and Amputation Prevention Center facilities.
  
  

RestorixHealth is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Retail Store Manager
description:
**Retail Store Manager**

**Metro by T-Mobile Authorized Retailer - JM Wireless LLC**

*Join the Innovation Movement!*

At JM Wireless, a Metro by T-Mobile Authorized Retailer, we're not just changing the game – we're rewriting the rules. As a Retail Store Manager (RSM), you’ll lead a dynamic team in delivering exceptional customer service experiences and driving store success. Unlock unlimited commission potential as you dive into a career. Every day will bring new challenges and opportunities to make a difference. Be YOU, and let's shape the future together!

As a Retail Store Manager, you'll lead by example, empower your team, and ensure our customers receive outstanding service. Collaborate with industry leaders and senior management to learn and develop an entrepreneurial mindset. Apply your training to drive business success as if it were your own. title: Director of Operations (Electronics Manufacturing)
description:
FlexStaff is seeking a **Director of Operations** for our client, a leading manufacturer of electronics devices for military, aerospace and commercial use.

This is a direct hire, permanent position in Melville, NY.

**Responsibilities**

* Oversee the development and evaluation of the manufacturing processes, utilizes knowledge of advanced product design, fabrication, assembly, equipment, tooling, and materials to direct the technology.
* Improve manufacturing efficiency by analyzing and planning workflow, space requirements and equipment layout.
* Advise and guides the operations team on groundbreaking techniques for new products, work processes, and other operational needs.
* Responsible for a wide degree of decision-making tasks while analyzing new design layouts for cost reductions, maximum workflow, and efficiency
* Provide manufacturing decision-making information by analyzing calculated production labor, and material costs; Supports production schedules as well as overseeing the estimate of future requirements
* Manage and approves meaningful cost studies, equipment recommendations and make/buy decisions.
* Oversee the development of vital assembly guides, operational manuals and illustrations for manufacturing processes utilizing computer aided design and manufacturing software applications in the effective execution of this activity.
* Participate and manages brainstorming sessions and cross-departmental meetings to increase productivity and decrease cost.

**Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree in Industrial or Manufacturing Engineering or equivalent. Masters preferred
* 15 years’ experience required.
* Knowledge of advanced manufacturing methods in test, assembly, and fabrication required for electronic hardware.
* Familiarity and experience with RF & microwave frequency products, subassemblies, modules, and printed circuit boards.
* Experience in wire bonding and working with chip and wire processes required.
* Familiar with a cleanroom environment
* Problem solver familiar with root cause analysis and project management.
* Excellent communications skills, teamwork, and problem-solving skill.
* Microsoft Office proficiency, CostPoint a plus
* Ability to obtain Secret Security Clearance.

**Benefits:** 

* Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance
* 9/80 Work Schedule
* Company-provided Life and AD&D Insurance

title: External Affairs Associate/Development Specialist
description:
**External Affairs Associate/Development Specialist**

The Museum’s External Affairs Associate/ Development Specialist is responsible for developing and acquiring and developing and stewarding fundraising opportunities and sponsorships; acquiring, monitoring and stewarding of outside partnerships with other organizations/ non-profits et al; acquire, monitor and retain the Museum’s membership database; conducting annual or specific appeals as needed; attending networking events as assigned by the Executive Director and developing, organizing and implementing our annual Light Keeper’s Gala and Golf Outing; assisting with the development of grant applications as needed; lead the team in developing branding and marketing opportunities; posting and expanding our Social Media venues including our website, Facebook, Linkedin and Instagram sites et al to improve our social image and promote our events.

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**

**EXTERNAL AFFAIRS DUTIES**

* Assure excellent customer service to visitors is being provided and be available to step in should issues arise when the Site Supervisor is unavailable or there is a need to help resolving issues
* If Site Supervisor is unavailable, need to step in to oversee docents/ interns/volunteers as needed to provide a proactive, welcoming atmosphere, greeting and interacting with visitors and directing towards exhibits et al
* Seek opportunities to market the Museum at every opportunity by helping to implement our marketing plan
* Use social media venues regularly to post appropriate events to enhance our marketing reach and increase attendance.
* Attend Networking activities as needed and directed by Executive Director, including Tabling events in collaboration with our Volunteers/ Interns/ Docents and Board & FRIENDS et al

**EVENT COORDINATION**

- Assure the tracking of the Master calendar of events – presentations, exhibits, Gala weekend, Fig Fest, Lighthouse Point Fest, Golf Outing et al are on track with event publicity/ flyers, Press Releases etc; work closely with the Graphic Artist Consultant and Site Supervisor to assure social media, Bonterra and any other publicity needed is accurate and sent out on a timely basis.

- Coordinate Event Committees/ Sub -Committees both via zoom or on site as needed to assure the input of all the Committee participants ex. Board of Trustees; Staff; FRIENDS et al.

- Maintain expense documentation/ spreadsheets for each assigned event to monitor the cash flow and income/ expenses.

- Assure app. thank you’s are sent in a reasonable time frame, as events occur.

- Maintain database ex. Bonterra or another platform to assure the donors are given credit for their donations for tax purposes and appreciation for their involvement with the Museum

- Support the administration in the implementation of grant agreements/ commitments including purchasing/ cost estimates, researching and ordering of materials to fulfill the required needs of different projects

- Assist the Executive Director in keeping track of appointments, scheduling meetings and organizing manuals, policies and procedures and other operational duties et al

- Perform other duties as assigned

**Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s Degree in Communications, English, Marketing, Journalism, Public Relations or related field
* 1-2 Years Experience in Non-Profit Sector
* Excellent Time Management Skills
* Excellent creative writing skills for marketing materials and communications, including pitch decks, social media posts, and internal emails
* Strong interpersonal skills, with the ability to develop productive working relationships with stakeholders across functional and organizational lines
* Creative thinker with an ability to quickly implement thoughtful solutions in a fast-paced environment
* Event, Vendor & Group Coordination Skills
* Computer Skills (Google Suite, specifically Google Sheets & Zoom)
* Point of Sale System Skills (Square Register)
* Donor Management Database Skills Preferred (Bonterra or equivalent software)

**Send or e-mail Resume and Cover Letter through indeed.**

title: Citizen Watch Co Woodbury Common Premium Outlets - Part-Time Keyholder
description:
**Citizen Watch America** represents the sales and marketing for the Citizen Group within the U.S., Caribbean and Latin American markets. The brands included within Citizen Watch America are Citizen, Bulova, Frederique Constant, Alpina, and Ateliers deMonaco. Each individual brand builds upon their very distinctive identities in the market with their unique, differentiated advertising, marketing and brand campaigns. As a combined company, however, the brands can assist each other and leverage the power that a larger unified entity brings.

Our vision is to lead the affordable luxury watch market by offering the most compelling collection of brands and products that are loved, favored, and respected by citizens of the world.

We will continue to leverage our heritage and expertise to enrich the lives of our current and future customers and Employees through unparalleled excellence in creativity, design, craftsmanship, innovation, technology, value, and service.

**Summary**

The Part Time Key Holder assists the management team in motivating hand inspiring their team to achieve store productivity goals. They assist the management team to develop action plans and analyze daily, weekly, and monthly sales.

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities** *include the following. Other duties may be assigned.*

* Work as part of the management team to achieve the store’s sales plans through consistent sales motivation, staff training, and customer service.
* Achieve personal sales goals.
* Develop a selling culture in the store.
* Model exemplary selling techniques and customer service.
* Works as part of the management team to train, supervise, and develop all store associates in customer service, clientele, company history, product knowledge, visual merchandising, and store operations.
* Leads team to ensure that all members of the store team are goal oriented, motivated and productive.
* Insures that all case lines are clean, pricing is correct and product is well merchandised.
* Responsible for managing the store when the General Manager and Assistant Manager are not there.
* Maintains adequate sales floor coverage.
* Assist the management team to track and ensure that KPI metrics are clearly communicated and achieved.
* Work with management team to ensure that sales associates are developing and maintaining long-term clients through the effective use of customer service.

**Qualifications**

* Flexible with work schedule to work days, evenings, weekends, per the needs of the business.
* High school diploma or general education degree (GED) preferred; or one to three years of related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
* Retail jewelry and watch experience highly desirable.

**Overview/Objective:**  
We are urgently seeking a skilled bilingual paralegal to join our team at American Chengyi Investment Management Group. In this role, you'll collaborate with our in-house attorneys, contributing to a wide array of business matters and associated briefing materials.

**Company Description:**  
American Chengyi Investment Management Group is a renowned real estate investment and development firm headquartered in Long Island, NY. Specializing in commercial, residential, and multi-use projects, we boast a diverse portfolio in Queens with exciting ventures on the horizon in Long Island. Additionally, we oversee partnerships spanning manufacturing, finance, cultural tourism, medical products, food import/export, and healthcare.

**Role Description:**  
This is a full-time position based in Great Neck, NY, ideal for a legal assistant or paralegal with a focus on real estate. You'll be integral to managing all legal facets of our real estate and construction endeavors. Salary ranges from $50,000 to $60,000 per year.

* Provide substantive legal support under attorney supervision.
* Assist in legal document analysis and preparation, conduct routine legal research, and compile data from various sources.
* Handle real estate document distribution and process documentation, maintaining both physical and electronic records.
* Ensure accurate and timely submission of legal documents.

**Qualifications and Skills:**

* Preferably one year of experience in a paralegal or legal assistant role.
* Familiarity with real estate closings, title report analysis, and title exception resolution.
* Proficiency in verbal and written communication in English and Chinese.
* Strong organizational skills, including document management proficiency.
* Comfortable using Microsoft Office suite.
* Ability to multitask and thrive in a fast-paced environment.

title: Full Stack Developer
description:
Ecosapiens – The #1 Climate Network Powered by AI and Blockchain

**About Us:** At Ecosapiens, we’re not just building software; we’re creating a future where technology drives real-world impact. Our core product, Ecolink AI, is revolutionizing sustainability labels and rewarding eco-conscious consumers with digital tokens. With over 400,000 users and 1.5 million digital tokens issued in just one year, we’re rapidly establishing ourselves as the industry standard in sustainability. We’re a fast-moving, high-performance team dedicated to making a difference on a global scale.

**The Role:** We’re looking for a Full-Stack Software Engineer who’s ready to dive in and push boundaries. You’ll be at the forefront of developing and optimizing our frontend and backend systems, ensuring our platform is scalable, secure, and user-friendly. You’ll work closely with cutting-edge technologies, from blockchain to AI, and be a key player in deploying machine learning models into production.

**What You’ll Do:**

* Develop, test, and maintain robust and scalable frontend and backend systems.
* Collaborate with our AI and blockchain teams to integrate innovative solutions into our platform.
* Design and implement intuitive user interfaces that enhance user experience.
* Work with APIs to connect our platform with external services and ensure seamless data exchange.
* Contribute to the deployment of machine learning models, ensuring they’re production-ready and optimized for performance.
* Drive rapid iteration and continuous improvement across the software stack.

**What You Bring:**

* 2-4 years of experience as a Full-Stack Software Engineer.
* Proficiency with technologies such as Typescript, Solidity, Next.js, GraphQL, Express, Prisma.
* Experience building scalable frontend and backend software solutions.
* A strong grasp of user interface design principles.
* A plus if you have experience with Rust, Thirdweb, and AI.
* A mindset that thrives in a fast-paced, high-stakes environment.
* A growth mentality: You seek the truth, take risks, and are always learning.
* Humility and kindness: You’re a team player who uplifts others while staying grounded.

**Why Ecosapiens?**

* Be part of a mission-driven team that’s playing to win—for the planet.
* Work on products that make a tangible difference in the world.
* Collaborate with passionate, cool, and fun individuals who share your drive.
* Join us at the cutting edge of technology and sustainability.

**Apply Now:** If you’re ready to take risks, move fast, and contribute to a future where technology powers sustainability, we want to hear from you. Let’s build something that matters.

title: Human Resources Director
description:
Paths is a full-scale, vertically integrated affordable housing developer, builder, and operator. Since 2004, the Paths team created and preserved high-quality affordable housing across the U.S. that enhances communities and helps residents build better lives. With over 12,000 units across 10 states under management and more than 400 employees, Paths manages a suite of capabilities spanning the entire property life cycle, including development, construction, property management, maintenance, and security.
  
  

**Summary/Objective:** Human Resources Director is responsible for fostering a positive workplace culture, enhancing career development, and improving overall employee engagement. This role involves developing and implementing engagement strategies, overseeing disciplinary actions, and ensuring effective communication between employees and management. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in human resources, excellent interpersonal skills, and a proactive approach to addressing employee concerns and promoting a harmonious work environment.
  
  

**Classification:**  

Exempt (overtime not eligible)
  
Hybrid Schedule – 3 Days in the office/2 days’ work from home
  
30% Travel throughout the portfolio
  
  

**Essential function/Responsibilities:** duties include but are not limited to the following:
  
* Create the training and development programs that will be implemented for the team members including orientation, departmental training, legally required training etc. Ensure this calendar continuously evolves and there is consistent participation and consistency.
* Develop and facilitate learning and development programs that align with the company's goals and employees' career aspirations.
* Recommends resources to address development needs and monitor’s progress.
* Identify training needs and coordinate professional development opportunities to support employee growth and satisfaction.
* Plan and organize events, activities, and initiatives to foster team building and a positive company culture.
* Work with the Executive Vice President of Human Resources and manage the disciplinary action process, ensuring fair and consistent application of policies and procedures.
* Conduct thorough and objective investigations into employee complaints and allegations, ensuring all concerns are addressed promptly and fairly.
* Maintain detailed records of all investigations, including findings and actions taken.
* Address and resolve employee conflicts and grievances in a timely and professional manner, maintaining a positive work environment.
* Ensure that company policies and procedures are communicated effectively and adhered to by all employees.
* Oversee the annual performance evaluation process, ensuring consistency and fairness.
* Work with managers to ensure they provide constructive feedback and support employee development.
* Track and analyze engagement metrics and trends, providing regular reports and recommendations to management.
* Conduct data collection and analysis to support operational decisions.
* Assist in succession planning.
* Support the Human Resources team with department goals.


**Other Duties:**  

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.
  
  

**Competencies:**  

* High attention to detail, especially when handling disciplinary actions and documentation.
* Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to manage multiple priorities effectively.
* Ability to analyze data, identify trends, and make informed recommendations.
* Expertise in creating and implementing learning and development programs to enhance employee skills and career growth.
* Skilled in guiding managers to provide effective and constructive feedback during performance evaluations.
* Ability to conduct thorough and objective investigations and document findings meticulously.


**Education and Experience:**  

* Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field required.
* SHRM/SPHR certification required.
* Real Estate Property Management experience preferred.
* Must be Bilingual - Spanish
* Minimum of 3 years of experience in human resources, with a focus on performance, development, and disciplinary actions.
* Knowledge of the nine-box grid for talent management and succession planning.
* Strong understanding of employment laws and regulations.
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
* Proven ability to handle sensitive and confidential information with discretion.
* Strong conflict resolution and problem-solving skills.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite.


**Salary Range:** $90,000-110,000 annually
  
  

**Benefits:**  

* We pay 100% of medical benefits, for employees only. Dental, vision, and additional benefit selection plan options are also available.
* STD, LTD. Life insurance
* Paid Time Off & Holidays
* 401k
* Commuter Benefits
* FSA
* Dependent Care


RRSP

title: Porter
description:
Residential Building Porter
  
Paths is a full-scale, vertically integrated affordable housing developer, builder, and operator. Since 2004, the Paths team created and preserved high-quality affordable housing across the U.S. that enhances communities and helps residents build better lives. With over 12,000 units across 10 states under management and more than 450 employees, Paths manages a suite of capabilities spanning the entire property life-cycle, including development, construction, property management, maintenance, and security.
  
  

**Summary/Objective:**  

The Porter is responsible for assisting the Maintenance team in the day-to-day duties involved with maintaining the cleanliness of our property.
  
  

**Classification:**  

Non-exempt (eligible for overtime)
  
  

**Essential function/Responsibilities:** duties include but are not limited to the following
  
* Daily interior cleanliness of buildings, including general cleaning of common areas tasks included but were not limited to cleaning up spills, cleaning windows and window coverings vacuuming, sweeping, stripping, waxing, and buffing floors.
* Daily trash handling and removal including emptying of the building’s compactors, breaking down and tying up cardboard boxes, and bringing trash and recyclables curbside for removal by the Department of Sanitation.
* Prepare vacant units for occupancy, remove all items left behind, and leave units in broom-swept condition.
* Required to perform exterior building and premises cleaning and basic maintenance, including exterior walls parking lots and structures, walkways and paths, gardens and lawns, outdoor furnishings, pools/curbs/gutters, exterior hallways and stairwells, etc.
* Light maintenance (replace light bulbs, air filters, blinds, shades, and other items as directed).
* Placing down mats/runners in inclement weather, and assisting in weather-related cleaning conditions (snow removal or storm preparations.
* Report areas for unsafe conditions, unlocked doors in restricted areas, and potential security breaches on the grounds and report to manager/supervisor


**Requirements:**  

* Thorough understanding of safety hazards and proper use of various cleaning and sanitizing solutions
* Highly motivated service-oriented self-starter (poses strong work ethic to get tasks done in a timely manner)
* Flexible and willing to work all shifts/hours as needed (capable of working additional hours)
* Ability to perform basic repairs and operate tools or equipment used in routine maintenance
* Good interpersonal skills with polite demeanor toward staff, customers, clients, and visitors to the property
* High School Diploma/GED
* Prolonged periods of standing
* Proficiency using large industrial cleaning equipment including a buffing machine for wood floors and other finished surfaces as well as large industrial vacuum cleaners.
* Due to the physical nature of certain required tasks, must be able to lift, bend, stoop, climb, reach, and lift to 50 pounds at a time


**Benefits:**  

* We offer 100% coverage for medical benefits to our employees. Additionally, we provide dental, vision, and other benefit options.
* The company offers a 401(k) plan with a matching contribution.
