title: SEO Manager
description:
Buzz Talent is a talent matchmaker connecting driven professionals and high-growth companies by placing the best fit for both the position and culture!

Our client is a rapidly growing banking and financial management platform for individual landlords and real estate investors backed by leading FinTech investors with a mission of empowering real estate investors to thrive.

**Pay Range: $100-$125K**

**Location: NYC Area (Hybrid role requiring 2-3 in-person days weekly)**

**What You'll Do:**

We are looking to partner a driven and experienced SEO Manager with our client who is ready to raise the bar on SEO and content marketing efforts for our client. You'll play a pivotal role in growing online visibility across the web, driving organic growth, and improving our search engine rankings.

**What Your Day-to-Day Will Look Like:**

* Refine and execute overall SEO strategy
* Own and drive the SEO roadmapLead a continuous process to identify product, content, UX, and technical SEO projects to grow Baselane’s organic search audience
* Conduct audits and research to pinpoint growth opportunities
* Develop and execute data-driven recommendations for SEO tests and changes, complete with thorough analysis and rationale
* Collaborate with our Content Lead and SEO/Content agency in the creation and optimization of our blog and web content to drive customer acquisition, engagement, and retention
* Execute changes to website architecture, linking, and other factors to improve SEO positions for target keywords
* Carry out keyword research using software such as Ahrefs to optimize our content
* Develop and implement link-building campaigns that can be implemented at scale
* Oversee on-page optimization efforts, including title tags, meta descriptions, header tags, internal linking, and content optimization.
* Manage external relationships with third-party agencies and tools where needed
* Identify opportunities for automation and process improvement with AI, staying up to date with recent tools and developments

**What you bring to the table:**

The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of developing and executing successful SEO programs in the past, a deep understanding of current SEO best practices, and the ability to link SEO's impact on the overall growth of the business with the following qualifications:

* 4+ years of experience developing and executing SEO strategy
* Experience in marketing B2B SaaS to SMBs and solopreneurs is preferred.
* Experience working in Google Search Console, Bing Webmasters Tools, Ahefs, SEMRush, Google Analytics, and Screaming Frog
* Knowledge of AI tools and their applications in content and SEO
* Experience running successful link-building campaigns.
* Experience with WordPress and other content management systems
* Understanding of search engine algorithms and ranking methods
* Deep understanding of SEO principles, techniques, and best practices.
* Experience building dashboards, reporting on and analyzing results
* Experience using BI tools such as Looker or Sigma to analyze and present data
* Strong project management and organizational skills
* Proven track record of improving search rankings and increasing organic traffic and revenue
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams.
* Able to work a hybrid schedule of 2-3 days/week in NYC office

**What Our Client Brings to the Table:**

* Competitive compensation
* Equity - Ownership in what we are building!
* High-quality Medical, Vision, and Dental Insurance
* Life Insurance and Disability Coverage
* Generous time off
* Flexible working hours and location
* Remote working stipend to set up a home office
* One Medical membership
* Regular social events

Hit that apply button and let's see if this is a match!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $100,000.00 - $125,000.00 per year

* 401(k) matching

* Monday to Friday

* Bachelor's (Required)

* SEO Copywriting: 3 years (Required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in New York, NY 10011

title: Social Content Creator
description:
Want to help grow the #1 “Fastest-Growing Agency”? Want to join a company whose brand is so strong that we get unsolicited clients reaching out every day? Want to help define the future of social media marketing?



Movers+Shakers is a new kind of agency built for the era of lo-fi, authentic social. We act as a creative AOR, influencer agency, and production house - streamlined to drive cultural relevance with Gen Z and Millennials.



Brands like e.l.f., Netflix, Dove, Red Bull, and Tinder rely on Movers+Shakers to win on social and beyond. We’ve gotten our clients over 250 billion views on social - from major brand moments to viral daily content.



The hype doesn’t stop with our clients’ brands. Fast Company named Movers+Shakers one of the "Most Innovative Companies" in the world, and AdAge named us a "Small Agency of the Year" (three years in a row). Adweek called us, "the best agency in the world at creating campaigns on TikTok."



We're really proud of our work, and we're even more proud of our culture. In their first week, new employees inevitably comment on how positive and supportive our workplace is. A month in, they're noting how little ego there is, and how departments collaborate surprisingly deeply. We only work with brands that share our commitment to spreading joy, and we have parted ways with client teams that don't treat our team with respect.



Intrigued? Read on…



**THE ROLE**



The ideal candidate is obsessed with hands-on content creation and has a passion for innovation and new digital & social platforms. You have a background in creating TikToks, strong editing skills, along with a deep understanding of production must-haves. You will also bring a knack for ideation, strategic know-how, and a collaborative mindset.



This role requires someone who is organized, creative, and energized by making great work, whether that be concepting in partnership with the broader team, or picking up a phone and shooting/editing a piece of content themselves.



This means making sure the production of that content is planned out, scheduled, and executed correctly (often by YOU!), and also that props and sets are considered. You will also have the opportunity to brief in and work with in-house editors on some projects.

  


**RESPONSIBILITIES**


* Ideate & execute the creation of platform-native social content that's on strategy & responsive to trends and consumer-focused ideation.
* Work independently and partnered with the creative team, content creators, influencers, and production partners in the development and execution of brand content.
* Work cross-functionally with account management, project management, strategy and creative teams.
* Regularly contribute to creative and strategic brainstorms to develop and create seamlessly executable, quick-turn content within timeline and budget parameters.
* Develop and write creative briefs for content creators and influencers.
* Contribute to the development and implementation of creative workflows, systems, and processes to improve creative output and operational efficiency
* Work simultaneously on multiple clients’ programs within tight deadlines, seeing projects through from start to finish.

  


**QUALIFICATIONS**


* **Living in the NY or LA area**
* Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite programs: Photoshop, Premiere, After Effects, Adobe Express, Illustrator, InDesign, Lightroom, and more.
* 3-5 years of content creation experience in a marketing setting
* Deep experience in design, editing and/or production
* Experience concepting and creating brand content across owned social channels
* Experience creating original and remixed content
* Comfortability working with in-app tools to create original content — e.g., filters, sounds, visual effects, etc.
* Master of in-app editing across platforms, including TikTok, CapCut, Reels, and beyond.
* Proficiency in hands-on content creation, handling production and creative execution
* Ability to ideate & concept original ideas both independently and in collaboration with team members.
* Extensive experience concepting and executing original content across TikTok, Instagram (Reels, Stories, Feed), YouTube (including Shorts), and other emerging platforms.
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment
* Strong attention to detail and commitment to quality
* Passion for delighting clients and going above & beyond
* Keen eye for detail with the foresight to think about the bigger picture
* Super organized, able to manage a ton of things simultaneously and follow tight deadlines


We look forward to hearing from you! 

  


**BASE SALARY RANGE**


**Our estimated range for this role is $65,000-95,000\\***


* Don’t let this range drive your decision to apply. Actual compensation packages are based on the level of skill and experience each candidate brings to their role. Similarly, there might also be a more senior or junior position available, that would be a better fit with your expertise. For example, a person may apply for a Senior Creative Producer role, and we may assess that their skills are at the Creative Producer level. Each level has its own compensation range.



At Movers+Shakers, we pride ourselves on competitive salaries, and we work hard to ensure there is pay equity across the company. We welcome open and honest conversations about compensation in all of our initial calls. We look forward to meeting you!
company_description: Niche creative agency spreading joy with original music & dance!

title: Old Navy Retail Sales Associate
description:
About Old Navy

Forget what you know about old-school industry rules. When you work at Old Navy, you’re choosing a different path. From day one, we’ve been on a mission to democratize fashion and make shopping fun again. Our teams make style accessible to everyone, creating high-quality, must-have fashion essentials for the whole family, with love, season after season.

We opened our first store in 1994 in San Francisco and have been on a roll ever since. We cultivate a community of playful personalities that thrive in a fast-paced environment where our employees can be their most authentic selves. Here, we’re family.

About the Role

In this role, you will engage and connect with our customers by providing excellent customer service. You will be an expert in product and use this expertise to educate, inform, inspire and outfit the customer. You will offer information to the customer on current merchandise assortment, store promotions and events, and execute operational processes effectively and efficiently. Your goal is to bring our brand to life for our customers while building brand loyalty and delivering with productivity.

What You'll Do

* All associates are expected to become experts of the brand's selling behaviors, leveraging these behaviors with every customer who walks through our doors and allowing us to provide a premium customer experience.
* Acknowledge and assist customers; locate merchandise efficiently using various methods; answer questions quickly and accurately
* Offer style and outfit suggestions to the customer, utilizing mannequins and displays for inspiration
* Promote loyalty by educating customers about our loyalty programs
* Leverage omni channel offerings to deliver a frictionless customer experience
* Support sales floor, fitting room, check out, and back of house processes, as required
* Courteous and responsive to internal/external request
* Exchange and verifies job related information to provide support

Who You Are

* Good communicator with the ability to utilize technology effectively and engage with customers and your team to meet goals
* Problem solver with a focus on continuous improvement, who is always learning, open to feedback and takes action as required
* Able to handle customer interactions and potential issues/concerns courteously and professionally
* Use basic information-gathering skills to solve problems
* Ability to learn procedural knowledge acquired through on- the-job training

Benefits at Old Navy

* Merchandise discount for our brands: 50% off regular-priced merchandise at Old Navy, Gap, Banana Republic and Athleta, and 30% off at Outlet for all employees.
* One of the most competitive Paid Time Off plans in the industry.\\*
* Employees can take up to five “on the clock” hours each month to volunteer at a charity of their choice.\\*
* Extensive 401(k) plan with company matching for contributions up to four percent of an employee’s base pay.\\*
* Employee stock purchase plan.\\*
* Medical, dental, vision and life insurance.\\*
* See more of the benefits we offer.

*\\*For eligible employees*

Gap Inc. is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to providing a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. We are committed to recruiting, hiring, training and promoting qualified people of all backgrounds, and make all employment decisions without regard to any protected status. We have received numerous awards for our long-held commitment to equality and will continue to foster a diverse and inclusive environment of belonging. In 2022, we were recognized by Forbes as one of the World's Best Employers and one of the Best Employers for Diversity.

Hourly Range: $15.50 USD  
Employee pay will vary based on factors such as qualifications, experience, skill level, competencies and work location. We will meet minimum wage or minimum of the pay range (whichever is higher) based on city, county and state requirements.

**US Candidates**  
Please note that effective, June 30, 2022, Gap Inc. will no longer require any of its employees to wear face masks or require proof of COVID vaccination, unless required by local or state/provincial mandates or as part of Gap Inc’s quarantine guidelines after being exposed to or testing positive for COVID. Therefore, please disregard any language in any job posting that refers to Gap Inc.’s face mask and proof of vaccination policy as said policy is no longer effective.

Pay: From $15.50 per hour

* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule

Shift:

* 8 hour shift

* Morning shift
* Night shift

title: Director of Nursing Level II- Service Delivery – Clinical Services
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals**

NYC Health + Hospitals/Community Care reaches outside the walls of our hospitals and brings health care to patients where they live. With more than 600 dedicated employees, Community Care provides services including home care, community care coordination, and community-based care management to individuals managing chronic health conditions residing in Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens and The Bronx.

At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.

**Job Description**

***PURPOSE OF POSITION***

Director of Nursing (DON) for Service Delivery – Clinical Services will be responsible for providing oversight of a team Assistant Director of Nursing as well as nursing staff who provide oversight to a clinical team in the coordination and rendering of care delivery in the Certified Home Health Agency (CHHA). The DON for Service Delivery – Clinical Services will be responsible for the delivery of competent, effective and safe clinical services, including but not limited to skilled nursing, as well as other interdisciplinary services. In addition, the DON for Service Delivery – Clinical Services will engage in efficient advisement, coaching and mentoring strategies to the members of the care team in order to meet clinical and professional goals. The DON for Service Delivery – Clinical Services will stay abreast of industry trends and regulatory guidelines that govern the home health care team and clinical practice.

The Director of Nursing for Service Delivery and Clinical Services is part of the leadership team that will focus on ensuring that the home care department, maintains a collaborative relationship with the acute and post-acute care facilities within the health system.

Duties & Responsibilities

***ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND AREAS OF RESPONSIBILITIES*** 

1. Develop and review metrics that lend to the growth of the CHHA and management of staff productivity and work performance.

2. Hires, trains and develops staff based on the growth of the program and operational needs of the organization.

3. Oversees the daily functions and activities of the CHHA Nursing Service Delivery team.

4. Liaises with acute and post-acute care discharge planning teams to ensure transition goals for patients are met.

5. Thinks strategically in planning for referral sources, patients and the home care department to improve on the quality of care being rendered.

6. Assures adequate supply of qualified staff based on operational needs and productivity targets. Assists with recruiting, hiring and orienting all clinical staff.

7. Provides one to one mentoring and education to direct reports as needed.

8. Provides adequate opportunity for education and ensures that all staff meets mandatory educational and in-service requirements on a timely basis.

9. Contributes to the overall operations and strategic planning for the growth of the Certified Home Health Agency.

10. Oversees the clinical staff assigned to the various CHHA Teams to establish and maintain positive, productive relationships with facility stakeholders and to support effective patient support.

11. Thinks strategically for our patients and caregivers, leveraging technology to streamline processes and improve quality of care.

12. Works closely with Directors of Clinical and Community-Based Services and TCNs to ensure compliance with home care regulatory guidelines, review “safe” discharge planning, payer limitations and restrictions.

13. Assumes on-call responsibilities as required and serves as back up to Assistant Directors of Nursing (ADN) for Service Delivery – Clinical Services.

14. Manages schedule of ADNs for Service Delivery – Clinical Services and ensures team coverage in the absence of the ADN for Service Delivery – Clinical Services.

15. Ensures that staff is counseled appropriately and timely with regards to work performance, attendance, punctuality, patient care quality and productivity issues.

16. Conducts employee performance evaluations and assists with the development of new job descriptions as needed.

17. Reviews and updates current job descriptions annually, and when necessary.

18. Ensures availability of structured onboarding plans for all assigned personnel.

19. Facilitates positive interpersonal relations among staff with a focus on promoting and modeling ICARE values in all engagements.

20. Ensures that the agency is following all Federal, State and accrediting body regulations.

21. Participates in short/long-range strategic planning and implements specific and targeted measures for growth.

22. Establishes workflows as needed to stream-line processes that will enhance operations and work performance.

23. Contributes to the development of marketing strategies and participates in programs aimed at improving the visibility of the home care department.

24. Strengthen relationships with new and existing patient care providers by daily or weekly follow-up.

25. Conduct ongoing assessments to ensure ADN for Service Delivery – Clinical Services presence, engagement and interaction within their assigned teams and direct reports and make changes when needed.

26. Conduct regular meetings to facilitate the dissemination of information and maintain the team’s ongoing connection within the Community Care network.

27. Assists with community relations and community education.

28. Travel between multiple post-acute and acute care sites required daily.

Minimum Qualifications

***Qualification Requirements:*** 

1. A valid New York State license and current registration to practice as a Registered Professional Nurse; and

2. Master’s degree from an accredited college or university in Nursing Administration or a related field and four (4) years of high-level responsible experience in nursing administration, three (3) years of which must have been in a hospital; or

3. A satisfactory equivalent combination of education, training and experience. However, all candidates must be licensed and currently registered to practice as a Registered Professional Nurse in New York State.

***DEPARTMENT PREFERENCES - MINIMUM KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES REQUIREMENTS***

1. Incorporates knowledge of cultural differences through effective instructional interactions.

2. Comprehends principles of adult learning and incorporates them in formal and informal educational activities.

3. Remain aware of current issues/trends in healthcare and translates them to the clinical team.

4. Maintain and model ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect and Excellence)

5. Maintains “state of the art” management/professional knowledge, credentials and skillset.

6. Functions in a way characterized by and conforming to technical and ethical standards.

7. Exhibits a courteous, conscientious and businesslike manner when interacting with all stakeholders.

8. Shows commitment to professionalism and excellence.

9. Provides leadership by satisfactorily managing relationships with and among customers (patients/clients, medical staff, volunteers, vendors, colleagues)

10. Demonstrates a capacity for accountability.

11. Is able to render decisions fairly and equitably, in a timely manner.

12. Articulates the organization’s vision in understandable terms and is able to model the organization’s vision.

13. Supports all appropriate hospital programs, including mandatories.

14. Develops goals, and objective and establishes plan to accomplish responsibilities.

15. Determines sources of conflict and responds timely to achieving a resolution.

16. Embraces cultural competence and incorporates the same in the daily team activities.

17. Prioritizes activities, follows through, and meets deadlines.

18. Skillfully and even handedly administers the human resources process (hiring, training, evaluating, developing, coaching and discipline) as related to the agency’s policies and procedures.

19. Provides educational opportunities for staff.

Additional Qualifications

***KNOWLEDGEABLE IN:*** 

Demonstrated knowledge regarding Federal, State and local regulations and JCAHO standards for Home Care.

Excellent verbal, written, organizational and analytical skills.

***YEARS OF EXPERIENCE:*** 

Minimum of 3 years high-level responsible experience in nursing administration

Minimum three 2-3 years of experience in home care

Minimum of 1 to 2 years’ experience in an acute care or in-patient post-acute care setting.

Minimum 1 to 2 years’ experience in discharge planning preferred.

Minimum 1 to 2 years’ experience in business development preferred.

Previous experience using various computer/mobile software applications: i.e., Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, OneNote.

***EQUIPMENT/MACHINES OPERATED***:

Smart phone Laptop Computer Desktop Computer Multifunction Copier

***COMPUTER PROGRAMS/SOFTWARE OPERATED***:

Epic H2O Hyperspace Epic H2O Remote Client Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, OneNote)

**How To Apply**

If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the "Apply Now" button or forward your resume to CommunityCareCareers@nychhc.org noting the above Job ID #.***110662***

NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:

* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
* Multiple employee discounts programs

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $140,000.00 - $160,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Education:

* Master's (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* RN License (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Coordinating Mgr - L B (Patient Accounts)
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals**
--------------------------------

  


NYC Health + Hospitals/Coler is an 815-bed nursing facility with a 5-Star CMS Quality Rating located on Roosevelt Island, nestled between Manhattan and Queens. Coler offers long term and subacute care, rehabilitation, and a dedicated memory care unit, comprised of 150 beds featuring an acclaimed music and memory program. The facility features a robust rehabilitation therapy program with expansive gym space for residents. Coler also offers full time physician staff, psychiatry, dental services, an onsite 8-chair dialysis den for hemodialysis, and on-site medical clinics to meet the clinical needs of its residents.


From more than 600 Nursing Homes, Coler ranks #5 in *Newsweek’s Best Nursing Homes in New York* *2024*; and also received a 2024 Silver Beacon Award for Memory Care.


At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.


**Job Description**
-------------------

  


**POSITION OVERVIEW:** Under general supervision of the Eligibility Director, assists in planning, organizing and supervising the functions and day-to-day activities of Financial Eligibility determination as relating to financial investigation and/or billing and collection sections. Participates in implementation of policies, systems and procedures relating to staffing, supervision of personnel, coordination, control, audit and review of required activities to maximize collection of in-patient billings, in accordance with policies and procedures established by the Corporation including preparation for billing, follow-up of collection cycle procedures, and maintenance of documentation flow for reimbursement. Serves as principal assistant to Director of Patients Accounts Eligibility division and assumes full responsibility and authority in his/her absence.Ability to travel within the five Post-Acute Care Facilities.




**SPAN OF CONTROL:**


Directly Supervises 13 Eligibility staff within the Post-Acute care Facility




**ESSENTIAL** **FUNCTIONS:**
----------------------------

* Managed and supervised of five Nursing Homes (Post-Acute Care Facilities) and Long-Term Acute Care Specialty Hospital, bed capacity of approximate 2,035 beds.
* Supervised thirteen staff ensuring the implementation of policies and procedures of the Corporation, NYSDOH and Patient Account Department of eligibility standards as they relate to the City, State and federal Programs for Medicare and Medicaid.
* Write, customized and implemented Standard Work for Post-Acute Facilities
* Collaborated with BlueMark (Electronic Portal for Medicaid application submission) and HRA in trouble shooting problems cases for the Post-Acute Facilities.
* Review Bluemark Medicaid software system on pending, approved or denied Medicaid cases and send out findings weekly email to Accounts Receivable (billing team) and Pharmscript via Secure email.
* Manages census and payer tree management in Point Click Care and EPIC system and validate for accuracy and conduct meetings with employees, managers, social workers, and Accounts receivable (billing) team.
* Reviewing various PCC and EPIC reports applicable to eligibility and reporting any changes to the billing staff
* Transmit Nursing home roster received from DOH into Excel format, compare with prior month roster for any changes in insurance plan, and send findings to eligibility and billing staff and Managed Care coordinators to obtain custodial authorization.
* Assess, collect paperwork, prepare Guardianship Referral for submission to Corporation Counsel, sign Guardianship Petition, and attend guardianship court hearing and monitor progress
* Assessment along with Social Work Department cases that lack citizenship documentation for NYLAG referral
* Educated staff and Post-Acute Care population on the Medicaid and Managed Care process according to DOH and HRA guidelines in order that the Post-Acute Care Facilities remain in compliance.
* Request self-pay bill for residents who are ineligible for Nursing Home Medicaid due to excess resources and request comprehensive bills to be sent to the Public Administration on decease residents
* Communicate expectation with HCI staff, address deficiencies and assist in maintaining and increasing Medicaid eligibility by timely casework submission
* Training new staff member on eligibility functions, describe productivity to insure goals, complete Human Resources annual evaluations for Eligibility staff, and sign off on staff weekly timesheet
* Review and sign off on monthly time and grant report and submit to respective team
* Coordinate and review work of subordinates relating to assigned tasks;
* Monitored the operations and efficiency of the office


Perform other duties as assigned by Eligibility Director


**Minimum Qualifications**
--------------------------

  


1. A Master’s degree from an accredited college or university in Public Health, Public Administration, Business Administration, Social Work, Psychology or Rehabilitation Counseling; and  

2. Two (2) years of full-time experience in medically-oriented health care and medical support systems environment, one (1) year of which included experience in an administrative or supervisory capacity in such occupations as physical, occupational, inhalation, speech and audiology therapy or as Medical/Laboratory Technologist, Microbiologist (various specialties), Chemist (biochemist), Radiation and X-Ray Technician; or two (2) years of responsible level experience in business management systems or general administration including one (1) year in a supervisory or administrative capacity; or  

3. A Baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university in disciplines listed in “1” above; and  

4. Three (3) years of full-time experience, as described in “2” above, including two (2) years of experience in an administrative or supervisory capacity in occupations, as listed in “2” above; or  

5. A satisfactory equivalent combination of education, training and/or experience.  

  

Note: Certification or licensure may be required.


**Department Preferences**
--------------------------

  


General knowledge of policies and program utilized in the operation of health care facility ability to assimilate and analyze data, to recommend action based on analytical findings, and to assist in the solution of complex problems in health care administration and management*.* Ability to analyze a problem or situation and make appropriate judgments, such a logical conclusion, feasible solution or most appropriate action. Be cognizant of all HIPPA privacy rules to PHI. Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Word and maintains statistical records and prepares status reports


**How To Apply**
----------------

  


If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the "Apply Now" button


NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:

* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
* Multiple employee discounts programs

title: Solutions Consultant
description:
**Company Description** **Our Mission**


At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission:


Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life.


We have the vision of a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. These aren’t easy goals to accomplish – but we’re not here for easy. We’re here for better. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are.


We’re changing the nature of work. Palo Alto Networks is evolving to meet the needs of our employees now and in the future through FLEXWORK, our approach to how we work. From benefits to learning, location to leadership, we’ve rethought and recreated every aspect of the employee experience at Palo Alto Networks. And because it FLEXes around each individual employee based on their individual choices, employees are empowered to push boundaries and help us all evolve, together.

 **Job Description** **Your Career**


The Solutions Consultant is the evolution of the traditional Sales Engineering role, aligning how we best serve our customers in understanding their environment, providing solution guidance and ensuring value realization in their investment with Palo Alto Networks. As a Solutions Consultant you provide technical leadership and expertise and guidance in your customer’s security transformation journey. You will play a key role in defining technical solutions that secure a customer’s key business imperatives and ensuring value realization of their investment with Palo Alto Networks. You evangelize our industry leadership in on-prem, cloud, and security operations services that establish PANW as your customer’s cybersecurity partner of choice.

**Your Impact**


Curiosity is core to the Solutions Consultant role, and you see complex problems as opportunities to learn and deliver innovative solutions! You define your impact by:

* Meeting and exceeding sales quotas by building and implementing strategic, technical account plans that target cross-platform solutions.
* Your ability to position, demonstrate and create high level designs across the entire PANW portfolio based on customer business needs

* Conducting discovery to understand and articulate the key technical, operational, and commercial imperatives of your prospects and customers
* Working closely with Professional Services, Customer Success and Specialist teams to ensure overall customer implementation and adoption of solutions.
* Demonstrating strong communication skills and the ability to influence through effective presentations and customer-specific demos, technical engagements, and workshops
* Leading successful technical validation efforts based on best practices to ensure technical win in assigned opportunities.
* Orchestrating supporting resources (Specialists, Channel Resources, Customer Support) to ensure a one-team approach that demonstrates a cohesive strategy
* Promoting end-to-end solutions that include PANW and/or partner professional services to ensure customers realize business value sooner
* Understanding the competitive landscape and effectively differentiating our leadership
* Continuously investing in yourself to develop technical and professional skills that drive your ever-increasing contributions to success of our customers while actively participating within the Solutions Consultant community and at industry events
* Identifying technical stakeholders and cultivating relationships with key personas to build and drive a security architecture transformation roadmap

 **Qualifications** **Your Experience**

* Understanding of data networking and/or modern application design and cloud architectures
* Delivering cybersecurity solutions that solve technical challenges and influence new business initiatives
* Influencing and gaining buy-in from key stakeholders, either in a customer-facing or internal role; prior experience in a pre-sales role is ideal
* Creating and delivering technical presentations, workshops, or technical validation engagements
* Experience in selling, designing, implementing, or managing one or more of the following solutions: Network Security, SASE, SaaS, CNAPP and/or SOC Transformation Technologies

title: Retail Sales Representative

*Join the Innovation Movement!*

At JM Wireless, a Metro by T-Mobile Authorized Retailer, we're not just changing the game – we're rewriting the rules. title: Provider Account Management Representative
description:
Centers Plan for Healthy Living's goal is to create the ultimate healthcare experience that provides our members, their families, healthcare decision makers, and general caregivers with the guidance and plans they need for healthy living.
  
  

**JOB SUMMARY:**  

The Provider Account Management Representative is responsible for the recruitment, contract submission, and maintenance of CPHL Medicare Network providers.
  
  

**PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:**  

* Recruit, negotiate, and initiate contracting of potential Medicare Network Providers
* Maintain detailed, accurate records
* Establish and maintain strong, positive relationships with providers
* Act as a liaison between providers, CPHL, and leadership
* Assure that all provider orientations, educations, and provider-related Grievances and Appeals are completed within established timeframes
* Facilitates resolution of provider-related issues with other CPHL departments (ex. Claims, UM)
* Maintain knowledge of current managed care regulations and trends
* Educates providers on complex issues
* Consults on proactive approaches to improve operational performance
* Evaluates network operations to identify risk areas
* Other duties as assigned


EDUCATION
  
* Associate degree or equivalent work experience.
* Bachelor degree preferred.


EXPERIENCE
  
* Minimum of two years in a health care profession.


KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS
  
* Excellent verbal and written communications skills
* Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously; efficient organizational skills
* Strong social skills with a positive and proactive mentality
* Effective time management, planning, and problem-solving skills
* Ability to work independently as well as within a team
* Knowledge of Medicaid and Medicare products
* Professional appearance and demeanor consistent with representing CPHL


ADDITIONAL COMPETENCIES (e.g. Certification, Frequent Travel, Language, License, Technology)
  
* Ability to travel within NYC and surrounding counties.


Centers Plan For Healthy Living is committed to leveraging the diverse backgrounds, perspectives and experiences of our workforce to create opportunities for our employees and our business. We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law and will not be denied employment.

title: Social Worker (Field Based)
description:
**Position Summary:**  

The Social Worker will provide intervention to promote social/ physiological well-being of patients in their home setting in compliance with applicable laws, regulations, and Agency policies.
  
  

**Job responsibilities may include but are not limited to:**  

* Interprets and implements the Agency’s philosophy to staff and members of the community.
* Works with the home care team (physician, nurses, therapist) to assess and evaluate home care needs and safety.
* Interviews patients and family to assess the patient’s understanding of illness and determine patient’s home environment and support system.
* Evaluates patient’s level of comprehension if procedures and/or treatment need to be performed, e.g. insulin injections, dressings, ostomy care.
* Explains home health agency services and policies to patient and family.
* Assist to ensure that home health agency is ready to meet the patients’ needs at discharge and arrange long term care referral process when applicable. Cooperates and provide feedback to the inter discipline team members.


**Qualifications:**  

* Current New York State license as a Social Worker required
* Minimum 1year experience as a social worker


Salary - $50.00 per visit

title: Health Care Economics Analyst
description:
At MVP Health Care, we’re on a mission to create a healthier future for everyone – which requires innovative thinking and continuous improvement. To achieve this, we’re looking for a Health Care Economics Analyst to join #TeamMVP. This is the opportunity for you if you have a passion for health equity and love for your community.
  
  

**What’s in it for you:**  

* Growth opportunities to uplevel your career
* A people-centric culture embracing and celebrating diverse perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences within our team
* Competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits focused on well-being
* An opportunity to shape the future of health care by joining a team recognized as a Best Place to Work for and one of the Best Companies to Work For in New York


**Qualifications you’ll bring:**  

* Bachelor's degree of applicable study with minimum of 3 years of experience in Health Care Analytics Role (or Advanced degree in math or statistics and at least 1 year of experience working with Health Care data
* The availability to work full-time, virtual (Eastern or Central time zone)
* Working knowledge of Provider Billing/Reimbursement methodologies
* Foundational knowledge of MVP's markets and products and awareness of competitive landscape
* Working knowledge of MVP Data assets including claim, pharmacy, member and provider data
* Proficiency in SQL and Microsoft suite of products including Power Platform
* Curiosity to foster innovation and pave the way for growth
* Humility to play as a team
* Commitment to being the difference for our customers in every interaction


**Your key responsibilities:**  

* Collaboration with team leader, peers and key stakeholders across the organization
* Research and query multiple data sources, manipulate large sets of data using appropriate tool
* Identify and Implement the most efficient solution for the business problem with forward thinking mindset to leverage automation and efficiency
* Leverage AI, Machine Learning or Statistical software where appropriate to advance analytics
* Validation of data, data models and reporting for accuracy and soundness
* Actively seek to draw inferences from the data to drive actionable insights/strategic discussions
* Actively seek to understand the why and how to add value to business request vs. just doing the request
* Actively challenge the status quo and find a better way
* Contribute to our humble pursuit of excellence by performing various responsibilities that may arise, reflecting our collective goal of enhancing healthcare delivery and being the difference for the customer.


**Where you’ll be:**  

Remote work environment; must be in Eastern or Central time zone
  
  

Pay Transparency
  
At MVP, we are committed to providing competitive employee compensation and benefits packages. The base pay range provided for this role reflects our good faith compensation estimate at the time of posting. Specific employment offers and associated compensation will be made individually based on several factors, including but not limited to geographic location; relevant experience, education, and training; and the nature of and demand for the role.
  
  

Affirmative Action

title: Battery Handler Driver
description:
Is this you?
  
* You are an experienced driver, comfortable operating large vehicles in urban areas
* You are safety driven
* You take pride in your work and a job well done


If the answer is yes, then we have your next career opportunity!
  
Spheara seeks to hire full-time, experienced Battery Handlers to safely prepare and transport light electric vehicle (LEV) batteries between depots and charging locations within the New York City area, and then monitor the batteries while charging. In addition, this position will complete recovery of disabled LEVs as needed and return to depot locations for repair.
  
About the Position
  
* Place batteries securely into transport cases and load/unload from company vehicles
* Operate large company vehicles throughout the New York City area. The vehicles may include a box truck (up to 16 ft), cargo van, and/or pick-up truck towing a trailer
* Place batteries onto charging stations and monitor while charging
* Complete recovery of disabled LEV assets as needed (may involve using a winch to recover and position onto the trailer), secure and tow on the trailer to the depot location for repair
* Follow all safety regulations and company policies and protocols
* Maintain company vehicles to standards, complete pre/post checks on vehicles, and follow fleet procedures


About You
  
* You bring previous experience as a driver of large vehicles, with an excellent safety record transporting items across busy, urban environments
* You have a valid driver’s license with an acceptable Motor Vehicle Record
* You value safety in all work activities, following all safety regulations and policies/procedures
* You provide a professional customer experience with all interactions, representing the company brand in a positive manner to both customers and the general public
* You are dependable and follow an assigned schedule, exhibiting a strong work ethic and the ability to work autonomously with a high level of productivity and self-accountability
* You can demonstrate the ability to lift and carry to 75 pounds, reach, stoop, bend, kneel, sit, and stand for extended periods throughout the workday and are comfortable working with electrical charging systems in a warehouse environment and transporting batteries


About Us
  
Spheara is a mobile, light-electric vehicle shop concierge service and a contracted vendor for fleet maintenance and repair. Our goal is to keep our delivery clients riding and delivering longer, by providing exceptional service with convenience. We focus on preventative maintenance and repairs for corporate clients.
  
Why Join Our Team
  
Each employee is a key member of our team responsible for the efficient delivery and performance of Spheara’s operations. We’re always looking for new people who aren’t afraid to roll up their sleeves to be successful, whether out in the field or working in one of our depot or office locations, to make a difference in our communities.
  
Transforming cities is more than just changing the way we travel and commute throughout the metropolitan area. We strive to support the communities we operate in by providing employment to those who need it most. We care about your passion, character, and determination to work hard more than your past.
  
We are seeking dependable, hardworking, team-oriented employees who want to build a career with Spheara and impact the cities in which we live and work. We’re looking for candidates who are professional, personable, and take pride in their work. Do you thrive off teamwork, a great place to work, and the feeling of a job well done? If so, we’d love to hear from you.
  
Career Perks
  
* Comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans
* Life, accidental death, long-term and short-term disability insurance options
* Paid time off and sick time
* Paid parental leave
* 401k retirement plan
* Free annual bike share membership
* Opportunities for growth


Interested? Apply now!
  
The above description is not intended to be a comprehensive list of all duties, responsibilities, or qualifications associated with the role. All employees may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities to accomplish Spheara’s mission.
  
Spheara is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Applicants are considered for positions and are evaluated without regard to mental or physical disability, race, color, creed, religion, sex, gender, national origin, ancestry, age, genetic information, military or veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, pregnancy, or any other legally protected status under applicable law. We also provide reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities in accordance with the Americans with Disabilities Act and applicable state and local law, as well as individuals who need an accommodation because of pregnancy or their sincerely held religious beliefs. If you require assistance or reasonable accommodation during any aspect of the application process or performance of your job, please contact the People Team or the hiring manager.

title: Assistant Manager, Brand Communications
description:
Job Title
Assistant Manager, Brand Communications
Job Description  

About The Position:  

The Assistant Manager, Brand Communications will work hand in hand with the Brand Communications team to provide support in the day to day duties of the PR Department including creating press lists, managing press coverage tracking, writing pitches and press releases, building relationships with key media contacts, managing media appearances, and working across print, digital, social media, and video platforms to move initiatives. This position will provide the opportunity to develop the necessary skills in the media communications space. The ideal candidate should be self-motivated, creative, and able to work in a fast-paced environment.  

This position is hybrid in-office, with the ability to work remotely for up to 2 days per week.  

About The Team:  

The Entertainment and Lifestyle Communications Teams oversee the communications and public relations for DDM brands ranging from PEOPLE and Entertainment Weekly to Better Homes & Gardens, InStyle, FOOD & WINE, Travel + Leisure, REAL SIMPLE, Byrdie, PARENTS, and more.  

About The Positions Contributions:
70%* Manage tracking of press coverage across all brands in tandem with the individual brand leads and contribute to the creation of media reports
* Research and develop new media lists for specific content pitches and maintain and update existing media contact lists on an ongoing basis
* Assist with development and distribution communications materials, inclusive of writing and copy editing
* Manage communications efforts for select brand initiatives, inclusive of drafting press pitches and announcements, as well as securing media appearances
* Respond to media inquiries in a timely manner in collaboration with brand leads, inclusive of providing editorial copy, images and assets and assists with coordinating interviews for press.
* Monitor consumer and trade media across broadcast, digital, print and social to keep the team updated on relevant reporting about our industry and what’s happening within the brands’ competitive landscapes.
* Manage awards submission calendars and submissions tracking.

  

15%* Manage media appearances, which may include calling in products, securing video, visuals, doing research, creating itineraries, helping to draft talking points, booking transportation and other logistical elements.
* Support PR at events, including maintaining guest lists, handling press check-in, distributing media alerts, and developing recaps


15%* Participate in brainstorms and ideation for PR strategy and tactics.

The Role’s Minimum Qualifications and Job Requirements
Education:* Bachelor’s Degree required.

  

Experience:* 1 - 3 years experience in public relations, communications, marketing, social media or related areas.

  

Specific Knowledge, Skills, Certifications and Abilities:* Superior written and verbal communication skills and excellent follow-through.
* Knowledge of lifestyle media in areas of lifestyle, celebrity, pop culture, style, home, decor, food, beauty, entertaining, and wellness.
* Highly organized with an ability to manage multiple projects with competing priorities, working under tight deadlines.
* Takes initiative
* Shares feedback, offers ideas, helps develop solutions to PR communications materials, issues, and other comms-related
* Ability to create press material and interact effectively with internal and external contacts.
* Knowledge and comfort using social media platforms to generate brand awareness.
* Understanding of key databases such as Muckrack, Cision, Burrelles, etc. and working knowledge of Google docs, sheets, etc.
* Experience pitching stories to the media.
* Ability to research, assess and access resources.
* Comfortable working both independently of others and as a team player
* Self-motivated, solution-oriented, and creative with an ability to think outside the box

  

% Travel Required *(Approximate)*: 10%

In addition, the Company will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. Accommodation requests can be made by emailing ddm.hr@dotdashmdp.com.

Women-owned, Garden Society is a craft cannabis company based in Sonoma County,

* Which strategy is most effective for promoting emotional and social development in preschoolers?

A. Providing opportunities for cooperative play and sharing to develop empathy and social skills  
B. Implementing strict classroom rules to teach order and discipline  
C. Encouraging competition in classroom activities to foster a sense of achievement  
D. Focusing on academic skills, such as reading and math, to prepare for elementary school

A. have no small parts that could be swallowed  
B. allow for independent play with minimal supervision

How should the teacher begin the unit?

C. Have the students draw pictures of characters from teacher-selected nonfiction books  
D. Lead the whole class in writing a nonfiction story together

title: NJ Resident Care Aide / HHA – Full-Time
description:
Looking for a career where you can make a difference in someone else's life? Where opportunities abound to advance your future, both personally and professionally? The Bristal Assisted Living is the place for you. You'll thrive in a premier senior care organization that values you as an individual — not just your experience and skillsets, but your unique talents and energy. You'll enrich the community in which you work, and that community will enrich you. We call what we do at The Bristal "hospitality with a higher purpose." We know you'll make an impactful difference. Because the difference is you. *Come join us!*


We are seeking compassionate and dedicated **Resident Care Assistants/Home Health Aides** with a skillset and a heart for helping residents make the most of each day. In this position, you'll be a friendly and familiar face to our residents, providing hands-on care in a respectful and dignified manner. Your role is essential to the care and safety of residents who choose to call The Bristal home. The loving care you bring to the services you provide is fundamental to the quality of life and the general wellbeing of our residents every day.


Additional responsibilities include:

* Assisting residents manage Activities of Daily Living (ADLs)
* Escorting residents to meals and recreational activities
* Supporting residents in achieving their highest level of physical, emotional and psycho-social well-being
* Helping out as needed in the Wellness area to ensure the safety, comfort and wellbeing of our residents
* Following all policies and procedures, and adhering to the instructions of the Nurse Shift Supervisor and the Director of Wellness

**Full-time schedule includes one weekend shift per week (Tues–Sat or Sun–Thurs).**

**Qualifications:**

* NJ-Certified Nursing Assistant or Home Health Aide
* Experience assisting those with Alzheimer's disease and dementia is a plus
* Must be able to speak and read in English
* Previous experience with geriatric population preferred, providing assistance with ADLs
* Ability to follow instructions and establish personal care routines
* Basic understanding of dementia; patience and professionalism in redirecting residents
* Ability to adjust to different personality types and situations in positive ways
* Must always be reliable, caring and gentle in touch and demeanor
* Maintain an abiding respect for the elderly and remain calm at all times

We are seeking a creative, compassionate, hands-on**Lifestyle Coordinator**to assist in presenting and coordinating recreational programs for our assisted living residents, as well as residents with Alzheimer's disease or dementia inour dedicatedReflections Memory Care Neighborhood. You will assist residents in making the adjustment to a new concept of living at our luxury assisted living community, not only encouraging them to continue pursuing their interests, hobbies and lifestyle activities, but also to develop new and stimulating interests, as well. You will help plan fun and safe trips to suitable destinations, such as art galleries, theaters, music venues, racetracks, sports events as well as religious and cultural programs. You will also help prepare, print and distribute copies of our monthly calendar, newsletters and memos to residents. You will also be expected to perform planned activities in the absence of the Director of Recreation. In this role you will maintain a knowledge of resident backgrounds, hobbies, special interests, and spoken languages, etc., and use this knowledge to encourage resident engagement and participation. The loving attention you bring to the assistance you provide is fundamental to the quality of life and the general wellbeing of our residents every day.


Full-time schedule includes one weekend shift per week (TuesSat or SunThurs).


The ideal candidate will have the following skills/qualifications:

* One year's prior experience working with a senior population, and those with Alzheimer's disease and dementia a plus
* At least 6 months of Recreation activity experience (art therapy, music therapy) or event leadership experience, and preferably in assisted living, long-term care or a similar industry setting
* Be outgoing, warm and have a genuine caring personality
* Able to create programs that get residents involved and excited
* Be dependable and able to supervise activities, special events and safe excursions for the residents
* Has creative talents in one or more areas, such as art, music, readings, dance, etc.
* Always maintaining oneself well-groomed and properly attired
* Demonstrates good listening and communication skills and always presents a positive spirit and professional attitude
* Possesses a proven ability to lead classes and other instructional learning sessions and speak in front of a group setting with ease, confidence and clarity
* Holds a high school diploma or equivalent at a minimum

title: Kitchen Utility Worker/Dishwasher – Full-Time
description:
Looking for a career where you can make a difference in someone else's life? Where opportunities abound to advance your future, both personally and professionally? Because the difference is you. *Come join us!*


We are seeking a responsible and experienced **Kitchen Utility Worker/Dishwasher** to assist the busy kitchen team of a luxury assisted living community with various job-related tasks and other support activities as they arise. The position involves sweeping, mopping and the cleaning of equipment, such as mixers, slicers, peelers, fryers, blenders and counters. The right candidate will take great care and pride in their work and consider this entry position as a potential stepping stone toward building a career in food services.


Additional job responsibilities include:

* Cleaning, prepping and washing dishware, silverware, glassware, pots and pans
* Ensuring all chemical dispensers are working and cleaning supplies are adequate, being careful to use all safety equipment to meet OSHA standards
* Sweeping and mopping floors as directed
* Emptying and cleaning garbage from kitchen to dumpster
* Assisting with heavy lifting
* Daily cleaning of steam kettle, grill, range tops, brazier, stainless steel surfaces, dish racks, dish storage areas, dishwasher and dishwashing area
* Monthly cleaning of all kitchen surfaces, including walls, ceilings, stairs, tables, table legs and appliances
* Assisting in the dining room, removing soiled dishes during meal service and returning them to the kitchen

**Full-time Schedule will include working the weekends.**


The ideal candidate will have experience in a busy kitchen or food preparation area and come with:

* Experience working in a restaurant, catering facility, hospital, hospitality, healthcare or similar food services related industry as a plus
* Must be able to operate in a fast-paced environment
* Must have physical ability for strenuous cleaning and lifting
* Ability to understand the English language and follow instructions with minimal supervision

title: Waitstaff- Per Diem
description:
Looking for a career where you can make a difference in someone else's life? Where opportunities abound to advance your future, both personally and professionally? The Bristal Assisted Living is the place for you. You'll thrive in a premier senior care organization that values you as an individual not just your experience and skillsets, but your unique talents and energy. You'll enrich the community in which you work, and that community will enrich you. We call what we do at The Bristal "hospitality with a higher purpose." We know you'll make an impactful difference. Because the difference is you. *Come join us!*


One of the strengths that sets The Bristal apart as a luxury assisted living community is our chef-prepared cuisine and the country club dining experience we provide three times a day. We are seeking friendly, professional and, above all, compassionate **Waitstaff** with the kind, patient and cheerful spirit to deliver on that exceptional experience. You know the satisfied feeling you get at an upscale restaurant when the servers do an excellent job? That's the same feeling we wish our residents to have every day, and as part of our Waitstaff team, your performance is key to making that happen. In this role you will be responsible for ensuring all meals are served and presented in accordance with the guidelines established by the Director of Food Service. The loving care, attention and great customer service you bring to the dining experience are fundamental to the quality of life and the general wellbeing of our residents every day.


Additional responsibilities include:

* Patiently and cheerfully taking resident meal orders
* Checking station tables for settings and cleanliness
* Reading the menu before service so that you can knowledgeably assist the residents with their selections
* Assisting in the plating and proper portion controls of some or all of the following: appetizers, salads, soups, beverages and desserts
* Bussing tables at the end of the meal


The ideal candidate will have the following skills/qualifications:

* Experience as a Waiter/Waitress in a restaurant or food-service-related industry
* Able to function in a fast-paced environment
* Have a strong ability to multi-task
* Possesses good communication, customer service and people skills
* Is professional, patient and able to satisfy a demanding customer base
* Experienceworking with a senior population is preferred, but not required
* Is a team player, willing to help out where needed to ensure a pleasurable dining experience
* Familiarity with food safety, food preparation and board of health guidelines is a plus
* Is able to adjust todifferent personality typesand situations in positive ways
* Must always be reliable, caring and gentle in actions and demeanor
* Maintains an abiding respect for the elderly and remains calm at all times
company_description: The Bristal Assisted Living is the premier in senior living with 24 locations throughout the tri-state area inlcuding Long Island, Westchester, Manhattan, and New Jersey.

title: NJ Medication Aide – Full-Time
description:
Looking for a career where you can make a difference in someone else's life? Where opportunities abound to advance your future, both personally and professionally? The Bristal Assisted Living is the place for you. You'll thrive in a premier senior care organization that values you as an individual — not just your experience and skillsets, but your unique talents and energy. You'll enrich the community in which you work, and that community will enrich you. We call what we do at The Bristal "hospitality with a higher purpose." We know you'll make an impactful difference. Because the difference is you. *Come join us!*


We are seeking compassionate and dedicated **Medication Aides/Technicians** to help our residents in the daily management of their medication. Working in our Resident Services Wellness Department, your assistance is key in helping residents take their medications safely, consistently and as directed by their physicians. This is a key area where our residents count on reliable support, and your attention to detail and disciplined approach will make a positive impact on their lives. Your role is essential to the care and safety of residents who choose to call The Bristal home. The attentive and loving care you bring to the medication services you provide are fundamental to the quality of life and the general wellbeing of our residents every day.


Additional responsibilities include:

* Assisting residents manage Activities of Daily Living (ADLs) and the administration of their medications
* Following all policies and procedures, and adhering to the instructions of the Nurse Shift Supervisor and the Director of Wellness
* Ensuring the safety and wellbeing of all residents, while following company policies and procedures
* Following Medication Administration Records (MAR) and doctors' orders

**Full-time schedule includes one weekend shift per week (Tues–Sat or Sun–Thurs).**

**Qualifications:**

* Experience assisting those with Alzheimer's disease and dementia is a plus
* Maintain an abiding respect for the elderly and remain calm at all times
* Extremely reliable, dependent and observant
* Ability to work one weekend day per week
* Must have at least an HHA/CNA certificate
* Solid understanding of MAR's and doctors' orders a plus (but we will train the right individual)
* Applicants must hold a New Jersey state med aide certification in order to apply for this position
company_description: The Bristal Assisted Living is the premier in senior living with 24 locations throughout the tri-state area inlcuding Long Island, Westchester, Manhattan, and New Jersey.

title: Driver – Full-Time
description:
Looking for a career where you can make a difference in someone else's life? Where opportunities abound to advance your future, both personally and professionally? The Bristal Assisted Living is the place for you. You'll thrive in a premier senior care organization that values you as an individual — not just your experience and skillsets, but your unique talents and energy. You'll enrich the community in which you work, and that community will enrich you. We call what we do at The Bristal "hospitality with a higher purpose." We know you'll make an impactful difference. Because the difference is you. *Come join us!*


We are seeking an experienced and responsible **Driver** with a clean driving record to transport our assisted living residents and recreation activity team members to scheduled events, field trips and activities in the safest possible manner. This is a key position where a kind and attentive demeanor with our residents contributes greatly toward improving their day. We're looking for someone upbeat and positive, who can make safety and security a top priority but also add a touch of genuine caring and humanity to their work. In this role, you will be in direct contact with residents who choose to call The Bristal home. So, above all, we look for professionalism, but also a kind and patient spirit. The loving care and compassion you bring to the services you provide are fundamental to the quality of life and the general wellbeing of our residents every day.


Additional responsibilities include:

* Assisting residents in getting on and off of the bus
* Greeting residents in a courteous and pleasant manner
* Abiding by all local and state driving laws
* Operating the vehicle responsibly, without weaving, tailgating, excessive lane changing, and all other irresponsible actions
* Coordinating proper scheduled vehicle maintenance and cleaning
* Reporting vehicle malfunctions to the Director of Recreation
* Reporting vehicle incidents to the Director of Recreation
* Completing incident reports for any resident accidents, injuries or episodes
* Ensuring the vehicle is cleaned out after every trip
* Performing errands as assigned by the Executive Director and/or Director of Recreation
* Assisting the Director of Recreation with activities-related assignments
* Performing other duties as assigned by the Director of Recreation, Executive Director or Manager on duty

***Please Note: Candidates must submit to a DMV background check. Only those with a clean driving record need apply.***


Requirements:

* Valid New York State Driver's License
* Clean driving record with no moving violations (DMV check will be conducted)
* Knowledge of care of vehicles and rules of the road
* Must be pleasant and courteous to residents and fellow team members
* Must be able to speak and read English
* Ability to work a flexible schedule
* Strong sense of direction and a thorough knowledge of layouts of the surrounding area
* Must have 20/20 vision and good hearing
* Willingness to assist recreation team and management with additional tasks as necessary

**New Jersey locations: Must have or be willing to get a COVID-19 vaccine, subject to legal accommodations**

description:

The Bristal Assisted Living is the place for you. In this position, you'll be a friendly and familiar face to our residents, providing hands-on care in a respectful and dignified manner. Your role is essential to the care and safety of residents who choose to call The Bristal home.
