American Dream’s immersive luxury shopping and dining experience – The Avenue – features Saks Fifth Avenue, Hermès, Saint Laurent, Dolce & Gabbana, Carpaccio, a fine-dining Italian restaurant, and much more. The retail collection is further expanded with flagship locations for Aritzia, H&M, PRIMARK, Uniqlo, Sephora and Zara; as well as the Toys R Us global flagship, the only standalone location in the U.S, and the world’s first and only “candy department store,” IT’SUGAR.
  
  

For more information on American Dream, visit www.americandream.com or find us on Instagram @americandream and TikTok @americandream\\_official.
  
  

**Key Objective(s):****The main purpose of the Guest Experience Team Lead is:**  

* To provide direction to the Guest Experience Team Members while ensuring that outstanding guest service is always provided to our guests while visiting American Dream attractions, and retail stores.


**Primary Responsibilities:**  

* Provide leadership to Guest Experience team members emphasizing guest service, safety, and cleanliness for all areas.
* Resolve guest issues or direct the matter to appropriate staff for resolution or action.
* Ensure the implementation of opening and closing checklists are completed for assigned areas.
* Operate a computerized POS (Point of sale) system in an efficient and timely manner.
* Perform the role of a Guest Experience team member.
* Assist in managing the daily operation of all attraction and retail store areas.
* Assist guests in the purchasing of American Dream tickets, gift cards, merchandise, rentals, and retail items.
* Serve as on-duty person in charge in absence of a Guest Experience Supervisor.
* Ensure that all team members are complying with company policies and procedures.
* Assist in training new team members.
* Assist with the documentation and communication of employee performance issues.
* Present positive and professional attitude towards guests, team members, and other departments.
* Ensure overall cleanliness and safety of the work area.
* Assist in monitoring inventory of attraction and retail store items.
* May provide direction/support in other work areas such as needed.
* Performs other duties/tasks as assigned.


**Desired Qualifications:**  

* Must be at least 18 years of age
* High School Diploma or equivalent
* 2-3 years previous cash register and guest services experience
* Previous leadership experience preferred
* Previous ice rink, retail, or theme park experience preferred
* Must possess outstanding guest service skills
* Strong verbal and written communication.
* Ability to resolve and remedy guest complaints, concerns and questions.


**Physical Job Requirements:**  

* Stand and move- frequently, 90% of time
* Perform repetitive motion (using keyboard)-Frequently, 70% of time
* Reach at or below shoulder level- frequently, 90% of time
* Stoop/Squat-Frequently, 70%
* Lifting/carry up to 20 pounds – Occasionally, 30% of time
* Lift/Carry up to 40 lbs-Infrequently, 20% of time
* Kneel and bend- Occasionally, 30% of time
* Reach at or above shoulder level –Occasionally, 30% of time
* Handle larger items such as boxes or packages- occasionally, 20% of time

title: Psychotherapist Wanted
description:
**Salary:** $60,000 - $75,000 DOE  
**Location:** Community Health Setting  
**Schedule:** 9 AM - 5 PM, with Tuesday-Saturday flexibility

Are you ready to make a real impact in a community health setting? Our partner is urgently seeking a dedicated **Psychotherapist** to join their team and start ASAP!

**Why This Role Rocks:**

* **Diverse Impact:** Work directly with clients facing mental health, substance abuse, chronic homelessness, and more.
* **Flexible Schedule:** Enjoy a non-traditional workweek with Tuesday-Saturday hours, giving you the balance you need.
* **Collaborative Environment:** Be a crucial part of the primary care team, influencing treatment plans and client outcomes.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Implement the **SBIRT** program to identify and assist clients with mental health and substance use issues.
* Provide brief interventions and coordinate care for clients needing behavioral health or substance use treatment.
* Collaborate with primary care providers, behavioral health teams, and care managers to ensure comprehensive care.
* Use your expertise to bridge communication between healthcare providers and ensure everyone is on the same page.

**What You’ll Need:**

* **Qualifications:** LMSW or LMHC
* **Experience:** At least 1 year of post-graduate work with individuals or families facing substance use, mental illness, or chronic homelessness.
* **Language Skills:** Bilingual in Spanish? That’s a big plus!

**Ready to Take the Next Step?**

If you're passionate about providing critical behavioral health care and thrive in a team environment, this role is for you. Apply today and start making a difference in the lives of those who need it most!

title: Case Manager (Korean) *Temp to Perm Role*
description:
The Case Manager plays a vital role in providing case management and remote monitoring for a caseload of patients with chronic health conditions. Essential duties and responsibilities include:

* Follow-up on clinical assessments and care plans to facilitate with applicable goals and interventions of the client
* Ensure the patient’s remote monitoring is being measured. Address and escalate any concerning measurements with the medical provider
* Advocate for and support the client while engaging with health care providers on the patient’s behalf with the goal of reducing emergency room visits and/ or hospitalizations
* Provide clinical support by providing consultation, education information around conditions and interventions in order to maintain focus on outcomes and best practices
* Submit progress notes and documents, records, and other related reports in an organized, timely and accurate manner as per policy and procedure
* Provide outreach and engagement of the patient to ensure all services are provided
* Provide crisis intervention and follow-up
* Perform other related duties as assigned

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

* Bachelor’s Degree Required

SKILLS AND/OR EXPERIENCE REQUIRED

* One year of related human services experience in providing direct services to patients diagnosed with chronic health conditions or other disabilities.
* Effective interpersonal, communication and teamwork skills required
* Experience with harm reduction and motivational interviewing techniques strongly preferred
* Work Location: One location - Brooklyn, NY

title: Community Liaison for Family Enrichment Center
description:
**THE ORGANIZATION**

Jacob A. Riis Neighborhood Settlement (Riis Settlement), a community-based non-profit organization offering comprehensive services to the youth, adults, older adults, immigrants and families of Western Queens, is dedicated to civic engagement and organizing as integral to our mission “to build and strengthen underserved communities and act as a catalyst for change.” For more information about Jacob A Riis Neighborhood Settlement, please view our website at

**ABOUT THE FAMILY ENRICHMENT CENTER (FEC)**

Supported by funding from the New York City Administration for Children Services (ACS) and the Division of Child and Family Well-Being (CFWB), the Family Enrichment Center (FEC) in Astoria will create a welcoming environment where community members can come together. The center offers a safe space for residents to connect, learn, and access essential resources for the betterment of families and individuals alike. Serving as a hub for support, FECs not only reflect the unique essence of the neighborhood but also provide direct assistance and valuable resources. What makes FECs special is their focus on community involvement; families actively participate in shaping the centers' activities and initiatives. By fostering connections and empowering residents, the FEC will contribute to the overall well-being and resilience of the Astoria community.

**JOB SUMMARY**

The FEC Community Liaison will be instrumental in establishing and nurturing relationships with FEC staff, community partners, and stakeholders. The ideal candidate will possess an engaging, empathetic communication style. The Community Liaison will work to strengthen the ties within the community, ensuring effective collaboration and support for the FEC’s initiatives. By fostering these connections, the liaison will play a crucial role in advancing the FEC’s mission and enhancing its impact in the community.

**JOB RESPONSIBILITIES**

***Major Duties and Responsibilities***

* Play a key role in the daily operations of the FEC, including developing and sustaining a parent/advisory group, building partnerships with other organizations to address community needs, and fostering a welcoming environment where residents can access family support, information, and services.
* Actively promote and recruit participants for FEC activities by presenting the organization's work to local community groups.
* Build a network of resources by participating in community district committees, attending local school meetings, and forming relationships with local groups and business associations.
* Greet newcomers warmly, proactively recruit volunteers, and ensure they feel like valued members of the team.
* Assist in developing and managing communication strategies, including social media and newsletters, to keep the community informed and engaged with FEC initiatives and events.
* Organize and oversee community outreach projects to identify and address emerging needs, ensuring the FEC's services remain relevant and impactful.

**STATEMENT OF SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:**

* An Associate’s Degree in social work, public policy, education, public administration, or related field; and/or equivalent experience.
* Bilingual preferred (English and Spanish, Mandarin, or Bengali)
* Lived and/or worked in Astoria or western Queens area preferred.
* Strong interpersonal skills to connect with and engage children, youth, and families.
* Experienced in data entry, generating reports, and making data-driven program decisions.
* Excellent organizational skills with experience in event planning or a similar capacity.
* Warm, outgoing, and enthusiastic, with the ability to positively impact diverse groups.
* Team oriented, skilled at engaging commitment and promoting cooperation.
* Experience in community organizing, political campaigns, and customer service preferred.

**Benefits:**

* Generous Paid Time Off package of 12 holidays, 12 sick days, 10 days of vacation, and 6 personal days.
* Retirement plan with 50% employer match up to 6% of total salary
* Student Loan Assistance and Education Assistance
* Health, Dental, Vision, and Life Insurance
* EAP Services

Jacob A. Riis Neighborhood Settlement is an Equal Opportunity Employer that does not discriminate on the basis of actual or perceived race, color, creed, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy, childbirth and pregnancy-related conditions), gender identity or expression (including transgender status), sexual orientation, marital status, military service and veteran status, physical or mental disability, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws and ordinances.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $50,000.00 - $55,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 403(b)
* 403(b) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Retirement plan
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Ability to Commute:

* Queens, NY 11101 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Queens, NY 11101: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Project Manager II - Engineering / Transportation
description:
**What We're Looking For**


At HNTB, you can create a career that is meaningful to you while building communities that matter to all of us. For more than a century, we have been delivering solutions for some of the largest, most complex infrastructure projects across the country. With our historic growth, it is an exciting time to join our team of employee-owners.


This opportunity entails being responsible managing assigned project(s) throughout their full lifecycle including developing the scope and technical sections of proposal and procurement documents to participating in contract negotiations and overseeing the delivery of the project plan to successfully accomplish HNTB’s 4 for 4 performance: delivery of quality work, on time, on budget and to the client’s satisfaction on every project. This position proactively manages the budget, schedule, technical requirements, contractual obligations, and client communications in support of the project’s objectives. Provides high level technical tasks while managing and reviewing design related specifications, calculations, reports and plans. Coordinates with internal and external partners including cross-discipline and functional teams to address and problem solve design related issues or concerns. The Project Manager II – Engineering typically manages multi-disciplinary project team(s) for one or more strategic (<$1M) or mini-mega ($1M to <$5M) projects, or may lead and/or work as a discipline lead on a mega ($5M to < $25M) project management team.


**What You'll Do:**


* Responsible for development of the project scope and fee quotation and assists in the preparation of technical proposals and contracts in accordance with HNTB's Sophisticated Contracting Approach (SCA). Leads or actively participates in client contract scoping and negotiations.
* Serves as the primary client liaison and manages the project team to deliver the scope, schedule and budgets to completion and to the client’s satisfaction. Leads client contract scoping and negotiations.
* Performs technical discipline tasks including analysis, reports, design, specification, and production for assigned projects.
* Implements the firm’s project delivery plan using HNTB's Sophisticated Delivery Approach (SDA) on each project. Leads the development and the execution of the project management plan. Supervises and mentors team to overall project objectives.
* Responsible for/oversees project staffing, including, but not limited to; recruitment, development, retention, and succession of project staff; development of plan for project staff reporting; and support for performance and compensation reviews.
* Partners with Client Service Leaders and pursuit champions to assist with business development, building client relationships, and pursuit efforts for mini-mega and mega projects in accordance with HNTB's Sophisticated Sales Approach (SSA). Works with the project team and marketing resources to prepare appropriate proposal and presentation materials. Leads proposal development and interview presentations for strategic, mini-mega, and mega projects to the client as well as general presentations within the industry and community.
* May be responsible for the recruitment, hiring, development and retention of staff, including development of plan for staff reporting, performance and compensation reviews, and succession.
* Performs other duties as assigned.

**What You'll Need:**


* Bachelor’s degree in Engineering and 10 years of relevant experience
* 2 years of successful management of engineering projects

**What You'll Bring:**


* Winning, contracting, and successfully delivering 4for4 (on-time, on-budget, quality, client satisfaction) on multi-disciplined projects. Identifying and handling risk and change management with guidance from more experienced staff.
* Leading a team on mid-sized and/or moderately complex projects inside and outside of HNTB using sub-consultants.
* Using system tools to manage, monitor, and deliver mid-sized and/or moderately complex projects.
* Leading with minimal assistance from the Office Management Team in implementing HNTB Sophisticated processes as applicable to the project.
* Serving as the lead interface with the client on moderately complex projects.
* Developing successors to work with same client on other work.

**What We Prefer:**


* Strong experience managing large projects for or with NJ transportation agencies
* Past experience with cost controls
* Master’s degree in Engineering
* 12 years relevant experience
* Professional Engineer (PE) certification

**Additional Information**


Click here for benefits information: HNTB Total Rewards


Click here to learn more about EOE including disability and vet


Visa sponsorship is not available for this position.

title: Baggage Handler
description:
Guardian is looking for experienced Baggage Handlers for Day shift. As a valued member of the Guardian Professional Services Team, you will provide safe and courteous baggage handling services to various airline passengers. Making Every Moment Matter for a World on the GO , our team understands that time is scarce, we provide unique combination of talentend people with industry leading technology we pledge ourselves to serve and prioritize each and every moment and do our Best Guardian style !

Here at Guardian Professional services we are looking for someone who is energetic, detail oriented, motivated and able to work independently or in a team. If you consider yourself responsible, reliable, self-motivated individuals who want to be part of a great team contact us today!

The Airline Baggage Handler will verify passenger boarding pass with their checked bag and move the bags to the security screening induction system.

This is a physically demanding position which requires on-the-job security training and the ability to receive all applicable airport security badges.

Communicating effectively and clearly. Asking each passenger the safety and security questions

* Loading passenger luggage onto the security screening induction belt
* Working closely with the Airline ticket counter agents

**Must be at least 18 years of age**

* Be authorized to work in the United States
* Must be able to clear a background verification.
* Must be able to lift up to up to 75 lbs consistently throughout the shift
* Ability to stand, stoop, bend, push, pull throughout entire shift
* Experience in customer service preferred
* Strong verbal and written communication skills using appropriate grammar, tone, and pronunciation to effectively communicate with internal and external customers
* Complete all required training including airport compliance
* Able to obtain an airport badge

Appearance Guidelines

Employees are expected at all times to present a professional business-like image, even when working behind the scenes. It is the policy of the Company that each employee’s dress, grooming, and personal hygiene should be appropriate to the work situation and be consistent with the Company’s business standards.

* For all male employees a fully grown in, well-maintained mustache, beard or goatee is permitted
* No visible tattoos or body piercings are allowed. Any tattoos must be covered by your uniform or other means agreed upon by management.
* Clean & well-maintained approved uniforms must be worn on shift
* Additional requirements as specified by management

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to use hands and fingers and to communicate with customers and fellow employees. The employee is frequently required to sit; reach with hands and arms; stand; walk. The employee is also frequently required to climb, balance, stoop, kneel, and crouch. In addition, the employee is required to of twist, turn, stretch, and bend on a frequent basis. The employee must be able to lift and move up to 75 pounds regularly. The employee must be able to move in a relatively quick manner. Specific vision abilities required by this job include Close vision, Peripheral vision and Ability to adjust focus.

title: Mgr - Performance & Optimization
description:
Job Description
AMC Networks is home to many of the greatest stories and characters in TV and film and the premier destination for passionate and engaged fan communities around the world.
We create and curate celebrated series and films across distinct brands and make them available to audiences everywhere. Our portfolio includes targeted streaming services AMC+, Acorn TV, Shudder, Sundance Now, ALLBLK and HIDIVE; cable networks AMC, BBC AMERICA, IFC, Sundance TV and WE tv; and film distribution labels IFC Films and RLJE Films. The company also operates AMC Studios, our in-house studio, production, and distribution operation behind acclaimed and fan-favorite originals including The Walking Dead Universe and the Anne Rice Immortal Universe, and AMC Networks International, our international programming business.
We are currently seeking a Mgr - Performance & Optimization to join our
Consumer Marketing & Media Team based in our New York, New York Headquarters.
JOB SUMMARY
The Manager, P&O role is responsible for supporting subscriber growth strategy development and analytics across the AMC Networks Subscriber Video on Demand services (SVODs) in collaboration with Media Strategy, Business Intelligence, Finance, and agency partners. Reporting to the Dir., Performance & Optimization Strategy, this role drives campaign/creative/platform insight, reporting, and optimization based on rigorous analysis of campaign, content and product analytics and thorough understanding of AMCN subscriber goals and KPIs.
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
ANALYTICS AND OPTIMIZATIONS: Provide strategic recommendation on optimizations needed, based on performance insights from internal and external reporting platforms – in partnership with the media agency* Evaluate performance trends by campaign, platform, audience, and creative to support paid media planning across AMCN subscription video on demand services, detailing recommended tactics and budgets across the subscriber acquisition funnel (awareness, consideration, conversion and retention).
* Provide recommendation on budget shifts between platforms, campaigns, and services to maximize efficiency, engagement, and LTV.


FORECASTING & PLANNING: Measure the performance of content on SVODs to inform future marketing and audience strategies.* Assist with forecasting across AMCN SVODs based on media plan recommendations including assisting with scenario analysis and forecasting to support decision making for optimal media plans.
* Support strategic planning and marketing investment planning with subscriber growth opportunities model and executive-ready presentations to summarize key findings and recommendations.


MARKETING ENABLEMENT:* Work with Product/Tech, Legal and other relevant teams to ensure enablement of functions that may ease tracking, reporting, and ease of site/app entry
* Ensure proper mapping and accuracy of overall reporting aligns with actual performance / media plans
* Support audience strategy, alignment, optimization, and delivery to drive campaign efficiency and alignment of efforts for acquisition and retention


STAKEHOLDER ENGAGEMENT:* Work with finance, research, and BI teams on forecasting and reporting across various growth scenarios.
* Support operational and executive reporting requirements for performance marketing team based on consistent metrics and KPIs across all AMCN SVODs.
* Coordinate with Content Strategy to leverage content across the variety of advertising and engagement platforms and provide audience performance insights to guide nimble editorial strategies


QUALIFICATIONS (Required & Preferred)* 5-7 years of experience in consulting, media agency, or a quantitative/data-driven role in digital media / subscription space.
* An understanding of streaming, subscription, and digital marketing KPIs.
* Very strong analytical skills with ability to derive insights from data; data-driven decision maker.
* Strong communicator (verbal and written).
* Strong attention to detail.
* Proven capability in managing projects, processes, and budgets
* Expert in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint, and expert written and verbal communication skills.
* Self-starter with a demonstrated ability to prioritize, manage ambiguity, and meet tight deadlines.
* Bachelor’s degree required, preferably in a related or quantitative field.


The base compensation range for this position is $85,000 to $100,000 commensurate with experience. AMC Networks additionally offers a comprehensive benefits package including Medical, Dental, Vision, Prescription Drug Coverage, 401k Plan, Wellness Program, Life Insurance, Tuition Reimbursement, Paid Time Off, Paid Parental Leave and Adoption Services, among other benefit plan options, subject to eligibility requirements. AMC Networks values the benefits achieved through in-office collaboration, but we provide our employees with the flexibility to work from home one day per week.*The Company is committed to policy of nondiscrimination in its employment and personnel practices. Applicants are considered for all employment without regard to race, color, religious creed, religion, alienage, citizenship, gender, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, genetic predisposition or carrier status, age, marital status, familial status, military or veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, stalking or sexual assault, sexual* *orientation, disability* *or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.*

title: Marketing/Sales Administrative Assistant
description:
**Parabit Systems** is a full-service engineering, design, integration, and manufacturing company located in the heart of Long Island, just 30 minutes from New York City. Our reach is nationwide, with satellite offices in Miami, Los Angeles, San Francisco, and Chicago. From total security solutions, to self-service kiosks and digital signage, Parabit's mission is to enhance and protect your business.

 **Summary:**

  

This position is the epicenter of the Marketing/Sales Department and provides a wide variety of support within the Marketing/Sales Department, which will help grow our Marketing and Sales efforts. The Marketing/Sales Administrative Assistant supports existing, new and potential clients; conducts market research projects that will capture potential new client contacts; and collects, organizes and reproduces company literature, presentations and proposals. The appropriate candidate for this role will be well organized, follows through on tasks, has a positive thoughtful & considerate attitude, and is transparent in all the work they perform. Parabit's clientele base is predominantly within the Financial, Security, Transportation, Education, Medical and Hospitality industries.

 **Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Provides support to the Marketing/Sales team
* Creates and reviews Marketing/Sales content for collateral/website/social media & email campaigns identifying grammatical errors and layout concerns, and then suggesting appropriate changes
* Prints, collates and copies digital product brochures and presentations for meetings, webinars, tradeshows and conferences
* Performs market and industry research
* Organizes and updates tradeshow collateral, orders tradeshow booth accessories, creates tradeshow files and schedules tradeshow vendors, suppliers and subcontractors
* Gathers current marketplace information
* Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops
* Contributes to creative projects and brainstorming
* Provides current status for all assigned open projects
* Other duties as assigned/required

 **Qualifications:**

  

Ideal candidate must have good interpersonal skills, be proficient with MS Outlook, Word, Excel, Power Point, and have prior experience utilizing Customer Relationship Management (CRM) software.

 **Education/Experience:**

  

* 3 years of related experience, preferably within a Sales/Marketing Department, demonstrating excellent customer service skills
* Candidates must have the ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing. Work requires an excellent command of the English Language. The ability to speak multiple languages is a plus
* Proficient in the use of MS Office Suite and CRM Software
* Good organization skills and can establish, maintain and communicate adjustments in priorities
* Possess the ability to analyze and prioritize workload and timelines while maintaining and enhancing weekly communication reports on all department performance metrics

  

Join an exceptional and energized team that shares a common belief in the value of creativity, operating with integrity, and leading through innovation. Parabit Systems is focused on growth and growing leaders. Parabit Systems is an equal opportunity employer, offering a great work environment, and challenging career opportunities. Please submit your resume via email to Recruiting@Parabit.com.

 **Benefits:**

* Medical
* Dental
* Vision
* 401K
* Group Life
* PTO


All employment candidates must pass a NON-DOT Drug screening, a background check, and personal assessment prior to employment.

title: Program Supervisor
Director of Housekeeping
description:
**Director of Housekeeping**

CLA Commercial Cleaning is seeking a Director of Housekeeping with a passion for excellence and great enthusiasm in providing exceptional service standards.

The Director of Housekeeping ensures that our guest accommodation and all areas front and back of house are maintained in a spotless condition at all times. They will also oversee the Hotel's laundry and valet services. The primary responsibility of this role is to ensure that CLA standards are met through the effective training and management of our Housekeeping team, ensuring that labor and other costs are controlled without compromising quality, and coordination with all other departments of the hotel.  
Some travel may be required for training, conferences and special events.  
**Job Requirements**

* To be successful in this role, you will be a passionate and motivated leader, with excellent personal presentation and interpersonal skills.
* A demonstrated ability to lead a multicultural team is essential, as is solid business acumen and a passion for service.
* Applicants are required to have three to five years experience with a diversity of Operational Rooms Division management positions.
* A college degree preferably specializing in Hotel management or business administration, or equivalent experience is recommended.
* Prior New York experience is preferred.

**Responsibilities** 

* Maintains standards of cleanliness and a consistent guest experience.
* To ensure a smooth, efficient, and economic operation in the Housekeeping departments. To specify and purchase supplies, and record all data pertaining to the Housekeeping and Laundry departments.
* To maintain a highly motivated and trained staff that continually strives for excellence in service and cleanliness.
* To maintain close coordination, communication, and interaction with front office, to ensure rooms are available for sale, and with Engineering to ensure guest room and all public areas are at peak operative levels.
* Close coordination and communication with other internal departments.
* Directly control the issuance and retrieval of associate uniforms.
* Effectively leads, manages and supports the Management Team in the day to day operations.
* Manages the Housekeeping Division Financials including payroll, expense management, productivity, purchasing oversight, forecasting, budgeting, meeting financial targets, etc.
* Monitor all guest requests to ensure they are met within the prescribed time limits.
* Inspect and tour all public areas several times daily.

title: Program Manager
description:
**DWELLNESS PROGRAM MANAGER** 

Dwellness is seeking their next Program Manager to help be the face of Dwellness! This is an exciting opportunity for a seasoned professional looking to grow in their career while playing a significant role in our organization’s success.

The Program Manager will help oversee growth and management for our dynamic psychotherapy team. We are looking for someone who is vision-focused with the ability to develop a comprehensive long-term strategy while also effectively overseeing day-to-day operational functions.

If you have a passion for driving excellence, creating strategic plans, and working within the field of mental health, we invite you to apply for this leadership position!

**ABOUT DWELLNESS:** 

Dwellness In-Home Psychological Services PLLC was founded in 2019 by Co-Founders Dr. Anna Levy-Warren and Jamie Weiner, LMHC. Dwellness provides in-home and tele-therapeutic services to individuals and families across the lifespan. Our clinicians have various discipline backgrounds and specialize in a diverse range of developmental periods and therapeutic techniques. We tailor our therapeutic approach to the specific needs of each client to address their presenting developmental, psychological, and psychosocial challenges.

We are a small yet mighty team, driven to help guide individuals and families towards healing in their home.

**ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITY:** 

The core responsibility of this position is to oversee business strategy, community impact, and program operations. The Program Manager will maintain all day-to-day management of communications and partner relations, while also working with the Co-Founders to develop growth-marketing strategy for long-term referrals and business development.

*While this role is primarily a remote position, we are looking for someone who is based in or near New York City, with the ability to occasionally meet clients and community partners in-person.* 

LEADERSHIP & OPERATIONS:

* Strategically identify opportunities for growth.
* Lead the Executive Team in the long-term vision and direction of the business.
* Direct all operations including management of staff. Oversee human resources and payroll.
* Oversee monitoring of patient fees, monthly superbills for clients requesting reimbursement, and addressing other financial questions as they arise.
* Optimize technology to increase organizational efficiency, improve information accessibility, and ensure data security.

COMMUNICATIONS & OUTREACH:

* Drive client success through overall company awareness and client support.
* Functions as the liaison between team and community partners.
* Develop marketing strategies to drive audience engagement, with awareness of subject matter material.
* Track and document the success of outreach campaigns, reporting insights and learnings to senior leadership.
* Oversee preparation of organizational-wide communications material, including but not limited to, internal and external newsletters, social media posts and content, etc.
* Maintain outreach documentation through CRM (Customer Relationship Management) portal.

COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIP:

* Proactively seek new opportunities and partnership for Dwellness to connect with other consumers and community-based organizations,
* Manage client relations with current program partners.
* Participate in planning, marketing, and public relations for the agency. Foster relationships within the community and network or develop strategic initiatives to increase referrals.
* Coordinate community contacts by clinic and security staff. Maintain database of all community relations activities.

PERFORMANCE IMPROVEMENT:

* Utilize data analysis and feedback to help identify opportunities for improvement.
* Implement initiatives for enhanced performance, growth, and employee engagement.
* Develop and monitor KPIs and metrics to assess operational performance and identify areas for improvement.
* Collaborate with the Co-Founders and clinical supervisors to help implement appropriate improvement measures.

**QUALIFICATIONS /EXPERIENCE:** 

* 5+ years of operational experience with demonstrated understanding of organizational management.
* Strong communication skills required. Ability to effectively collaborate with others.
* Demonstrates excellent team and project management skills. Maintains clear organization and plans with structure.
* Passion for growth!
* Ability to lead change in evolving environments
* Works well independently and on a team. Has a ‘can-do’ and self-starter attitude. Promotes teamwork with the ability to inspire enthusiasm, productivity and accountability.
* Outstanding customer service and client relation skills. Communicates effectively verbally and in writing. Articulates complex information.
* Comfortable sharing ideas with clarity, vision, and ready to lead with oversight.
* Ability to manage multiple projects at once while continuing to function effectively.
* Creative thinker with close attention to detail.
* Knowledge of standard office programs including Google Workspace, Canva, and Microsoft PowerPoint. MailChimp, Squarespace, and CRM experience are a plus.

**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS**

* MSW, MHC or Masters’ degree in psychology or related field.
* NYS clinical license preferred.
* Experience working with a program that serves adults with serious mental health conditions.
* Experience working within a startup environment.

**BENEFITS & COMPENSATION**

* Full-time salary: $75,000 annually, commensurate with experience
* Paid vacation: Three weeks/year
* Paid Time Off for federal holidays
* Access to New York State Paid Safe & Sick Leave
* Community building/social activities for Dwellness Team
* Opportunity to develop and execute unique programming with the support of the Dwellness Administrative and Supervisory Teams.

* Vision insurance

* Monday to Friday

title: Order Processor/Picker
description:
Samuel & Sons has enjoyed more than three quarters of a century of making the impossible possible. And along the way, we've never lost sight of what matters most - the people who've helped us get where we are and the close-knit family feeling that encourages each of us to do our best. Samuel & Sons people have the drive to overcome any obstacle and the spirit to take on any challenge. As a family-owned company with an immense appreciation for its employees, Samuel & Sons is a great place to work. The opportunities are yours for the taking. And the benefits are among the best in the industry. Samuel & Sons continues to maintain its competitive advantage, achieve superior customer satisfaction and improve the overall company performance by creating an inclusive workplace that empowers each employee to make valuable contributions, be as unique as they are, and promote reaching their fullest potential. Samuel & Sons appreciates the rich diversity of the people in the communities where we work. Therefore, we aim to create and maintain a professional environment where differences are respected, varied skills and abilities of diverse individuals are valued and all may contribute to the success of the organization.

**Our Core Values**

* We are **CUSTOMERCENTRIC**: The customer is at the heart of everything we do.
* We are **HUMAN**: See people as people deserving of our trust, respect, and integrity.
* We are **UNITED**: A community that supports each other through individual perspectives and collaboration.
* We are **PASSIONATE**: Driven and committed to being better every day.
* We **PUSH BOUNDARIES**: Move beyond what is by challenging assumptions and embracing change

 **WHAT YOUR DAY LOOKS LIKE:**


This position is responsible for accurately picking, labeling, distributing, and putting away fabric trim orders destined for ultra-high-end residential, hospitality, entertainment and similar venues within established deadlines. The key areas the successful individual will always focus on include our customers’ experience, quality, productivity, and the development of their team.


**PRINCIPLE RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Picks the correct inventory from bays/bins -while having the ability to pick the best fitting piece- based on order size.
* Labels/Re-spools if necessary and returns all inventory to the dedicated locations, meeting all established productivity and quality requirements set by management.
* Records low inventory levels and replenishes them from overstock location.
* Communicates and collaborates on issues with orders or product with the team in a timely manner.
* Encourages and enforces established company values and warehouse standards or requirements for quality, productivity, safety, and housekeeping.
* Assists with the performance of inventory audits as requested.
* Ensures bins are labeled correctly and updates if necessary.
* Maintains inventory including the upkeep of a clean and organized warehouse.
* Leads by example and encourages compliance with company policies and procedures.
* All other duties and tasks as may be assigned.

  


Requirements:  

  

**SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE:**

* Organizational ability
* Solid communication skills, both written and verbal
* The ability to work in a team environment
* The ability to lift up to 50 lbs. without accommodations, climb ladders as necessary, carry freight and stand for the majority of shift
* High School diploma / GED preferred
* Ability to work under constant pressure and meet deadlines.

 **WHAT WE OFFER:**

* Comprehensive medical, dental & vision with HSA option
* 401K plan with a 4% company match
* 15 days PTO, floating holiday option, and 10 holidays
* Positive and collaborative work environment

  

 Samuel & Sons is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, education, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics and celebrates the diversity of its growing team.

  

We are unable to sponsor or take over the sponsorship of employment Visa at this time.

  

Recruitment agencies and consultants may not submit resumes/CVs directly to managers through this website. Samuel & Sons does not accept unsolicited agency resumes and will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Samuel & Sons.

  


Salary:  

  

$16.75 hourly


The offered base pay for a position is influenced by several factors, including the candidate's work experience, education/training, job-related skills, internal peer equity, and market and business considerations. The scope and responsibilities of the position also play a role in determining the salary range. The figures provided are reflective of a NJ-based position, and if authorized to work outside of this location, the salary may be subject to geographic adjustment based on a specific city and state.

title: Marketing Innovation Lead
description:
We are looking for a Marketing Innovation Lead passionate about creating innovative growth hacking initiatives that push the boundaries of traditional marketing. In this role, you will be responsible for developing and executing innovative, out-of-the-box marketing strategies designed to maximize brand visibility and engagement. You will collaborate closely with the marketing team to integrate guerrilla tactics and non-traditional social media activations into our broader campaigns, ensuring alignment with our brand identity and marketing objectives

**Our work model is hybrid, combining remote and on-site work**. This lets us get things done when and where we are most productive.


The US base salary range for this full-time position is $175,000-$185,000. Our salary is to be determined by multiple factors including but not limited to relevant experience, knowledge, skills, locations and other job-related qualifications, and alignment with market data. In addition to salary, this position may be eligible for bonus, equity and benefits.

  

Requirements:
  

* 7+ years of experience in growth hacking, guerrilla marketing, or a related field, preferably within a global or digital-first company.
* Exceptional ability to analyze data in order to extract meaningful insights, and apply these insights to drive decision-making and campaign optimization.
* A proven track record of developing and executing highly creative, unconventional marketing campaigns.
* Proficiency in marketing analytics tools, social media platforms, and content management systems.
* Strong analytical and strategic thinking skills, with the ability to translate creative ideas into actionable marketing plans.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to effectively pitch and present ideas to both internal teams and external partners.

  


What am I going to do?:
  

* Conceptualize and Execute Guerrilla Campaigns, develop and implement unique, attention-grabbing marketing campaigns that resonate with target audiences, using unconventional methods and social media to drive brand awareness and engagement.
* Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with the broader marketing team, including content creators, social media managers, and digital marketing specialists, to ensure guerrilla campaigns are cohesive with overall marketing strategies.
* Performance Tracking: Analyze the success of marketing activities through key metrics and KPIs, providing detailed reports and recommendations for future initiatives.
* Innovative Thinking: Continuously explore new and emerging marketing trends, tools, and platforms to stay ahead of the curve and bring fresh ideas to the table.

  


Equal opportunities:  

  

At Fiverr, we prioritize diversity. We celebrate difference and embed it into every aspect of our workplace, from our community to our product. Fiverr is proud and committed to providing equal opportunity employment to all individuals regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, citizenship, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. In addition, Fiverr will provide accommodation to individuals with disabilities or a special need.

title: IT/MSP Sales Representative
description:
**About the job**

Intrinsic Technology Group (ITG) is seeking experienced Managed IT Service - Sales Representatives with a minimum 2-5 years of experience.

We offer leading Managed IT Services - help desk support, network & server monitoring, private cloud hosting, cyber security platforms, application & cloud support, backup solutions, and disaster recovery & business continuity solutions.

· Responsible for driving sales revenue and market share growth measured by quota targets

title: Internal Audit Manager
description:
This job is responsible for overseeing assigned areas of audit work acting as an Auditor-in-Charge (AIC), and executing on the audit strategy for Lines of Business (LOBs). Key responsibilities include driving risk-based auditing by defining scope and test procedures to evaluate the control environment in conformance with audit policies, assessing issues for business impact and recommending severity ratings, drafting audit reports, and managing business partner relationships. Job expectations include fostering an inclusive work environment, and mentoring team members.

This role is for the Global Corporate and Investment Banking audit team. We cover audits for businesses such as equity capital markets, debt capital markets, investment banking, corporate banking coverage and leasing. The team is also responsible for credit risk management and global payment services audits in EMEA.

The candidate will be working with the team based in EMEA and APAC and most of our audits are global. An Audit Manager is expected to lead audits and a team of auditors working on the audit. This role will also support the management team with ongoing Audit related tasks.

Responsibilities:

Executes audit strategy for the sound application of risk-based auditing by defining audit scope and audit programs, and drafting audit reports leveraging automation and innovative methods in a timely and high quality manner

Acts as Auditor-in-Charge (AIC) by overseeing audit testing and ensuring it is executed in a timely manner and conforms with quality standards, audit policies, and procedures

Assesses impacts to business processes, controls, and strategies to provide recommendations on severity ratings and escalate broad themes or trends accordingly based on existing business knowledge

Exercises intellectual curiosity and judgment to effectively influence and challenge management to improve the control environment and drive continuous improvements on audit

Oversees a team of associates and provides day-to-day mentoring and guidance and fosters an inclusive work environment

Maintains business partner relationships, primarily with line management, to develop business knowledge

Exercises sound knowledge of product, business, and technical expertise to effectively challenge management to improve the control environment

Manage multiple projects using technology and analytic techniques to work effectively and efficiently in a fast-paced environment.

Required Qualifications:

Minimum 3-5 years covering Internal Audit in the Corporate and Investment Banking Business, GCIB (e.g. equity capital markets, debt capital markets, investment banking, corporate banking, leasing etc) (tier 1 investment bank preferred)

Minimum 8-10 years of internal audit, front office business control or compliance experience in financial services

Minimum 2 years of experience leading audits and performing in the role of auditor-in-charge

Ability to plan, execute and evaluate audit test plans within a risk-based audit methodology

Sound organizational, analytical, oral, and written communication skills

Experience with stakeholder management and ability to influence management and lead changes (including respectful and objective challenge of stakeholder views on risks and controls)

Experience with leading a team, project management and coaching less experienced team members

Pro-active, positive attitude, exhibits sense of ownership, flexibility and intellectual curiosity

Ability to manage/ juggle multiple work efforts and deliver quality work timely

Bachelor’s Degree

Desired Qualifications:

Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA), Certified Public Accountants (CPA), Financial Risk Manager (FRM), Certified Internal Auditor (CIA) or relevant qualifications

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $150,000.00 per year

* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

title: Warehouse/De-Install Technician
description:
**Position Description:**  

This position is responsible for assist with on-site removal of medical imaging systems which includes packing, lifting and pushing the systems out of the warehouse securely.

* Assist the team leader with the on-site removal of medical imaging systems. This includes placing the system on dollies, and pushing the system out of the building and on to a truck packed securely.
* Unloading and loading trucks, for warehouse pick-ups and deliveries.
* Performs warehouse functions, provided by the manager, including but not limited to, disinfecting, cleaning, crating, packing, etc.
* Responsible for moving anything within the warehouse with the use of forklifts or pallet jacks.

* Any other duties as assigned

Required

title: ZogSports Field Manager - NJ
description:
**Love organized Sports** **and** **being hands-on? Then this is your chance to assist ZogSports with our day-to-day operations in your community by joining our Operations team! ZogSports is America's most popular adult social sports community, with operations in New York, New Jersey, DC, Los Angeles, San Francisco and San Jose.**

**RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES**

As a Field Manager, you will assist the ZogSports Operations team with the execution of our on-site operations, help facilitate and train new hires regarding facility procedures, and help maintain healthy relationships with facility partners. We're looking for fun, team players who are reliable and organized, communicate effectively, care about their work, take ownership and strive for continuous improvement.

**Are you:**

* At least 18 years old?
* Available to consistently work 3 shifts during weeknights and/or weekends?
* Passionate about sports?
* Strong in communication and problem-solving skills?
* Fun, outgoing and social?

**Do you want to:**

* Be an ambassador for ZogSports, promoting a fun and social experience at every game?
* Manage on-site logistics?
* Help improve the quality of all ZogSports activities?

**If you answered "YES" you may be ready to join the TEAM!**

**MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Drop off, set up, break down and lock up equipment (may involve heavy lifting)
* Train new field team on facility details and equipment setup/breakdown
* Evaluate, maintain, and report on equipment inventory for new and existing facilities and leagues
* Identify issues with league operation and provide solutions
* Communicate consistently with full-time staff and Elevated Field Team members
* Develop and maintain relationship with facility staff
* Represent the ZogSports brand

**KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:**

* Effective communicator
* Detail oriented
* Resourceful, good at solving problems and critical thinking
* Reliable, Organized, Team Player attitude
* Takes initiative
* Ownership over duties

title: Legal Assistant - NY Personal Injury
company: Brandon J. Broderick, Attorney At Law
description:
### **About Brandon J. Broderick, Attorney At Law:**



Brandon J. Broderick is a prestigious and forward-thinking law firm committed to delivering exceptional legal services. With a blend of tradition and innovation, we are dedicated to staying at the forefront of legal practice and technology.



Come join a team, in a fast-paced environment, where the culture values Transparency, Accountability, Empowerment, Teamwork, Passion, Giving Back, Diversity, and Inclusion. At Brandon J Broderick, you will be provided with **training, mentorship, a career path** along with **perks** such as **Summer Fridays, competitive benefits, a robust holiday schedule, and work-life balance**! We care deeply about or employees and our clients. Our commitment to these values ensures a supportive and inclusive environment where every team member can thrive and contribute to our collective success.



Join us in making a difference and building a fulfilling career.


**Responsibilities**


* Scan/saved all incoming mail, emails and faxes.
* Calendar all notices with respect to defense examination, depositions, arbitration, mediation dates and court notices
* Send all notice letters to clients involving DME, depositions, arbitrations (when applicable), mediation and court appearances.
* For depositions, arrange for court reporter and translator and/or videographer, if needed, when noticed by our office.
* Confirm all attorney appearances the day before the event.
* Obtain all medical Request narrative reports under the direction of the paralegal or attorney.
* Compile and arrange all medical records in electronic file so they can be attached to Form A responses.
* Draft cover letter for amendments and serve with attachments on defense.
* Schedule Plaintiff Medical Exam (PME) and compile and send all relevant medical records and MRI films to PME doctor after attorney reviews and
* Handle incoming calls along with Paralegal.
* Handle funding requests.


**Qualifications:**


* Past experience as a Legal Administrative Assistant
* Can take direction via email and/or verbally
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Proficient with Windows/MS Office Applications including Outlook Calendar, Word, Excel.
* Knowlege of Adobe PDF a plus
* Past experience working on NY Personal Injury cases as an Administrative Assistant a plus

  


*Salary offered will be based on applicant's prior work experience.*

  


**Benefits:**

* Health Insurance

* Sick time

title: Office Services Associate
description:
**Job Title:** **Hospitality Associate**

  


**Reports To:** The **Hospitality Associate** will report to the Client Services Supervisor, Client Services Manager, or equivalent leadership.

  


**Job Overview:**



This **Hospitality Associate** position is directly responsible for the presentation, ordering, stocking of food and beverages onsite for all client gatherings, including meetings, events, interviews, seminars, and conferences. This position directly supports the onsite needs associated with onsite setup and tidiness of professional workspaces.



Overall, this position continuously offers the highest level of service to all client and SPS employees while maintaining a professional image of the company by providing prompt, courteous and efficient service.

  


**Duties and Responsibilities:**


* Provides 5-star customer service to all employees (in all forms of communication).
* Orders, stocks and inventories, maintenance, preparations, and presentations of products.
* Sets up meeting spaces for onsite needs such as meetings, conferences, or meals.
* Submit work orders for certain requests.
* Service and replenish the barista, pantry, conference, kitchen, or meeting areas.
* Will perform meeting room and conference room set-ups.
* May perform building occupant moves within assigned facilities.
* Will perform light maintenance and cleaning duties as assigned.
* Maintains the Business Service Center area in a neat and orderly fashion.
* Monitors level of office supplies on the floor, and replenishes and orders accordingly.
* Proactively seeks out additional work during downtime.
* Builds professional relationships with customers and other teams.
* Maintains professionalism and composure when interacting with all employees.
* Trains back-up and providing guidance on policies and procedures.
* Determines what additional support is needed when handling sensitive inquiries.
* Provides exceptional customer service to client.
* Provides reception or concierge (front of office) and mail or office services (back of office) coverage as needed.

  


**Competencies**:


* Strong verbal and written communication skills.
* Excellent hospitality and customer service skills.
* PC skills – MS Office Suite experience.
* Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously.
* Good organizational skills.
* Requires knowledge and understanding of technological ordering systems and ability to comprehend instructions.
* Possesses the ability to work independently and is capable of completing projects.
* Adaptable and flexible to needs at a moment's notice.

  


**Qualifications and Education Requirements:**


* High School Diploma (or equivalent) required.
* 1-2+ years prior work experience preferred.
* Ability to work assigned work hours determined by the manager.
* Excellent organizational and time management skills.
* Analytical abilities and aptitude in problem-solving.
* Superb written and verbal English communication skills.
* Current knowledge or ability to learn computer-based systems required for functions of position.
* Required to maintain an overall professional appearance and attitude.
* Adhere to all policies and procedures required.

  


**Physical Demands:**


* Approximately 50% of the time this position requires the below physical demands.
* Fine and/or gross motor skills, including the ability to grasp, lift and/or carry or otherwise move packages on a standard wheeled cart with a load capacity of 60 lbs.
* Ability to walk, bend, kneel, stand, and/or sit for an extended period of time.
* Manual dexterity is required for operating office machinery (phone, copy machines, binding equipment, etc.).
* Ability to lift or move 40 lbs. or greater frequently.
* Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.
* Must be able to utilize computer monitor and keyboard.

  


**Travel: None or Negligible**

  


**Other Duties:**



This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

 **WHAT WE OFFER**


* **Career Growth:** An opportunity to enter a job that allows you to learn new skills or use a variety of them that may lead you to uncover other career opportunities!
* **Learning & Development:** At SPS, we promote a work culture of learning so that you can develop to be the best at what you do!
* **We Recognize Talent:** We offer a variety of recognition programs for all levels of employees!
* **Benefit Offerings:** Medical, Dental, Vision, HCFSA, DCFSA, HSA, Commuter Transit and Parking, Supplemental Life Insurance, Accident Insurance, Critical Illness, Hospital Indemnity, Legal Program, Identify Theft Protection, Pet Discounts, Pet Insurance, Group Home and Auto Insurance, EAP, Short Term Disability, Life Insurance, Education Discounts, 401k w/ matching, Entertainment Discounts, & Paid Time Off.
	+ Note: Please inquire with the Human Resources team for benefit offerings per role as regular positions that routinely are under 30 hours/week may have a different benefit offering.

**About SPS**


**SPS** is an award-winning employer of choice offering outsourcing solutions that leverage Intelligent Automation (Artificial Intelligence & Robotic Process Automation) in more than 22 countries across the globe.



In North America, our services include Mailroom Management (both physical and digital), Office Services such as Reception, Lobby Concierge and Conference Room Management in addition to Document Processing Services utilizing leading edge technologies. Our clients today are companies in sectors such as banking, insurance, legal, higher education, advertising and other professional services, including many Fortune 500 companies.


**SPS** is committed to delivering high caliber outsourcing experience to our clients and offering our employees challenging and exciting career opportunities throughout the North America region and globally. SPS is committed to investing in the professional development of our employees and offers competitive comprehensive benefits and diverse development training programs that lead to building careers.



At SPS we embrace the uniqueness of our employees and are committed to the fair and equal treatment of all people, applicants, and employees by promoting a culture of access, inclusion, equity and diversity.



SPS provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual and reproductive health choices, national origin, age, disability, genetics, military status, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation and/or any other status protected by law.

title: IMA Certificate Compliance (IMACC) Operations Manager
description:
IMA's Certificate Compliance (IMACC) team is seeking an Operations Manager! This person will be responsible for overseeing the operations of the IMACC team by furthering the IMACC team objectives and results primarily by developing appropriate processes, organizing client data, and coordinating onboarding of new Specialists, under the guidance of the IMACC Managing Director.

* Organize and track client renewals by working with Specialists to gather information and adhere to timelines
* Manage the onboarding and training of and directly supervise new IMACC Specialists

title: Director R&D Consumables
description:
**TITLE:**  Director R&D Consumables  
**TYPE:**  Direct Hire  
**LOCATION:** Asbury Park, NJ  
**ONSITE/REMOTE/HYBRID:** Onsite  
**START DATE:**  July/August 2024  
**SHIFT:**  Day Shift

We are looking for a Director of R&D Consumables. The Director of R&D for Consumables is pivotal in leading the charge for innovation within our pet product portfolio. This role is centered around spearheading product development initiatives, optimizing existing processes, and introducing cutting-edge technologies to achieve strategic business goals while fulfilling or surpassing consumer expectations. Managing a talented team of scientists, engineers, and technicians, along with close collaboration with essential stakeholders, is key to identifying research priorities, managing project timelines, and efficiently allocating resources.

**MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Promote and integrate new and existing business processes to amplify their impact, advocating for continuous improvement.
* Spearhead innovation within the consumables segment, enhancing product offerings to meet evolving market demands.
* Uphold and exceed standards in product quality, formulation, and specifications to satisfy operational, regulatory, and consumer needs, with a keen eye on production economics.
* Direct the entire pet food product development lifecycle, from conceptualization to deployment.
* Champion innovative product development, transforming insights from experimental research and consumer behavior into successful market introductions.
* Foster interdepartmental collaboration to set benchmarks for product innovation success.
* Guarantee that products are produced and controlled in a manner consistent with quality standards within a GMP framework.
* Explore new avenues for innovation, focusing on claims, nutritional value, profitability, and sustainability, by staying abreast of industry trends, competitor products, and technological advances.
* Maintain strict compliance with all regulatory standards set forth by USDA, FDA, AAFCO, and FISMA for food manufacturing.
* Engage in organizational initiatives to further corporate objectives.

title: Transitional Residential Aide 4pm-12midnight shift
description:
The Apostles’ House (TAH) is a non-profit, non sectarian organization devoted to providing comprehensive social services to homeless women and children and individuals or families at risk of homelessness in Newark and Essex County, New Jersey. TAH seeks to help homeless and at-risk families transition to more stable housing environments and become self-sufficient through an empowering environment.

**Role Summary:** 

Residential Aides – Transitional housing program will report to the Housing Director. There are part-time positions available, and 2 shifts requiring on duty Residential Aides. The shifts are day (4pm-12am) and overnight (12am-8:00am). This position will work onsite at The Apostles House transitional housing program. This program is designed to be a safe space homeless families with children. Residential Aides will assist in the 24/7 operations of the home. Residential Aides will have direct contact with residents on a daily basis and will provide assistance with activities, events, off-site trips, cleaning of the units/facility and documentation of daily tasks. Residential Aides will help to ensure that house rules and operational procedures are followed. All staff is expected to model behavior consistent with good citizenship, self-respect, and respect for others.

**Responsibilities:**

 Report to work on time and on a regular basis.

 Train and monitor residents in the implementation and integration of independent skills such as bed making, laundry, etc

 Train and encourage residents, as needed, in daily self-care practices.

 Converse with residents to reinforce positive behaviors and to promote social interaction.

 Supervise and assist residents in punctual attendance of scheduled daily programs, i.e., school, work, medical appointments, therapy, support groups, etc.

 Accompany residents on trips set up by administration

 Aid administration in administering therapeutic and leisure activities, such as physical exercises, occupational arts and crafts, and recreational games, to residents

 Observe and document daily progress report with medical issues, incidents, maintenance orders etc.

 Maintain the cleanliness and neatness of indoor and outdoor areas, i.e., residential units, offices, bathrooms, foyer, staff lounge

 Perform antiseptic cleaning duties, laundry, and other housekeeping duties as directed.

 Report any immediate safety hazards to appropriate supervisory personnel or maintenance personnel. Complete written work order requests for maintenance needs.

 Attend and participate in required training sessions and staff meetings.

 Willing to work evenings, weekends, and holidays.

 Adhere to safety, hygiene, health, and fire hazard guidelines; policies and procedures; and mission and values.

**Required Qualifications and Experience:** 

 High school diploma, or equivalent

 Must be at least 21 years of age

 Previous experience in a social service field

 Strong written and verbal communication skills

 Proven ability to work with diverse communities

 CPR and First Aid training and certification required within 3 months of hire

 Driving: Must have valid New Jersey Drivers license and a clear driving record.

 Must pass State background check

title: ESG Manager
description:
**About Us:**


Founded in 2000, CompoSecure (Nasdaq: CMPO) is a technology partner to market leaders, fintechs and consumers enabling trust for millions of people around the globe. The company combines elegance, simplicity, and security to deliver exceptional experiences and peace of mind in the physical and digital world. CompoSecure's innovative payment card technology and metal cards with Arculus security and authentication capabilities deliver unique, premium branded experiences, enable people to access and use their financial and digital assets, and ensure trust at the point of a transaction. For more information, please visit www.CompoSecure.com and www.GetArculus.com.


We are committed to fostering a sustainable future through innovative practices and responsible business operations. Join our team and be a part of our journey towards a more sustainable and eco-friendly world.

**Position Overview:**


We are seeking a hands-on and analytical ESG Manager to join our team. This role is essential in driving our sustainability initiatives and ensuring accurate and transparent reporting. The ESG Manager will be responsible for driving ESG efforts for the organization, as well as measuring and improving our environmental, social, and governance (ESG) practices, with a particular focus on recycling, carbon footprint reduction, and eco-friendly procurement. This position requires a blend of communication, analytical, and ESG expertise. It also requires strong collaboration with internal and external stakeholders to support the success and reporting of our sustainability goals.


The ESG Manager position requires an onsite presence at our office in Somerset, NJ and will report directly to our Chief Operations Officer.

 **Key Responsibilities:**

* Manages all aspects of the ESG data collection process including setting deadlines, assigning responsibilities, and monitoring, expediting, summarizing, and communicating progress at regular intervals to ensure the organization meets it annual ESG reporting deadlines.
* Prepare materials to deliver to relevant stakeholders and assist in the development, documentation and execution of the ESG disclosure reporting program.
* Conduct ongoing benchmarking of ESG and sustainability disclosures relative to our peers, industry trends, and best practices.
* Recommend and manage eco-friendly initiatives, acting as the project manager and internal sponsor.
* Coordinate and compile information for CDP (Carbon Disclosure Project) reporting, ensuring timely and accurate submissions.
* Work with external partners and vendors to enhance our ESG reporting capabilities.
* Partner with Communications and appropriate internal functions to support development of our annual ESG report.
* Serve as the primary point of contact for internal and external ESG-related inquiries.
* Collaborate with various departments, including supply chain, procurement, and facilities management, to drive sustainability initiatives.
* Engage with customers and vendors, providing support and completing necessary ESG forms and documentation.
* Assist in the development and execution of long-term sustainability goals and objectives.
* Evaluate the financial impact of ESG initiatives and recommend cost-effective solutions.
* Stay updated on industry trends and best practices to ensure the company remains a leader in sustainability.

 **Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Environmental Science, Sustainability, Business, or a related field.
* 5-7 years of experience in ESG, sustainability, or related roles, preferably within manufacturing, packaging, printing, automotive, or pharmaceutical industries.
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data and generate actionable insights.
* Proven track record of managing sustainability projects and driving organizational change.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively engage with stakeholders at all levels and external vendors.
* Familiarity with CDP reporting and other sustainability reporting frameworks ( Ecovadis, ISS. ...).
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
* Background in financial analysis related to sustainability initiatives.

  

CompoSecure is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, or national origin. We are also an equal opportunity employer of individuals with disabilities and protected veterans.
